Kabibi has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years. She makes women and men suits. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Balla, c’est l’homme qui tient la corde du bœuf sur la photo. Agé de 27 ans, Marié, sa femme est ménagère. Mr Balla n’a pas été à l’école ; Il est père de 3 enfants dont  un (1) garçon est scolarisé, et sont âgés de 02 à 7 ans.
Il fait cette activité d’élevage bovine depuis plus de 04 ans, il s’approvisionne dans les marchés d’environnant.
Balla est un client de RMCR depuis 2013 et il est à sa cinquième cycle, selon lui, il apprécie beau-coup les services de RMCR.
Après la vente son bénéfice peut varier entre 50 000 f à 90 000 f C FA. Avec ses profits il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : comme en  couverture sanitaire, habillements, et alimentaires
Balla souhaite dans l’avenir avoir plus de fonds afin de pouvoir acheter plus de bœufs, avoir plus de l’aliment bétail pour les animaux
texts.en:
Balla is the man holding on to the rope attached to the cow in the photo. He is 27 years old and married; his wife is a housewife. Balla did not go to school. He is now father to three children, one boy is at school and the others are two and seven years old respectively. He has been raising cows for more than four years now and he gets his animals in the surrounding markets.

Balla has been a customer of RMCR since 2013 and is on his fifth loan cycle; according to him he much appreciates the services of RMCR. His profits on the sale of his animals can vary between 50,000 and 90,000 FCFA. With his profits he is able to provide for his family's needs, such as health cover, clothing and food. Balla would like in the future to have more money so he can buy more cows and food for his livestock.

loans.use: to raise cows to sell.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 24 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the Gurjaani district of Georgia.

Vakhtang is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and produces wine. Vakhtang wants to start a trading business and has requested a loan.

The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase fruits and vegetables and will trade from his car from village to village.

Vakhtang hopes that this will give him a stable income and that he will be able to cover everyday expenses. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 38-year-old married man and has two children. He’s really attached to his family. He works hard to be capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life.

He is an employee in a company. He had to work really hard to prove that he can provide the necessary support for his family.

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay fees for his children's studies. One of his greatest dreams is to see them achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to pay fees for his children's studies

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en: Jeni is a 26-year-old single Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and her two siblings. Her father is the main source of income to satisfy their family needs. Jeni is focusing on her study and works in parallel as an employee in a company. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for her courses in hairdressing and make up. In the future, she plans to take out more Kiva loans to do more courses and start working in beautician services.

loans.use: to pay for her courses in hairdressing and make up.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 56-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children.

Despite their bad circumstances, Najah is making a great effort by cooperating with her husband to satisfy the family’s needs. She has owned a small mini-market in her town since 2005.

Today, Najah is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase merchandise for her business in order to enhance her job and increase her revenue.

Najah is an optimistic person always aiming for the best and plans to receive more Kiva loans in the future to keep improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her mini-market.

loans.name: Rocio Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rocio es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 

Desde hace 16 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 12 horas.

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de sus tres hijos. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), muebles y remodelaciones a su local; esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Rocio manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rocio is a women who is dedicated to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead, overcoming the various obstacles on her way.

Sixteen years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon which is located in a space in the house she resides in. She also offers service to homes according to the needs of her clients. She works 12 hours per day.

This allows her to generate sufficient resources to help her husband with the household finances and cover the needs of their three children.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a hair dryer and supplies wholesale (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner and nail polish amongst others) furniture and renovations to her shop. This will allow her to continue with her work and offer a more complete service to her clients, in a more flexible and efficient manner. This will benefit the margin of profit that she gets from her labor.

Rocio says that her greatest wish is to be able to continue her work, position and strengthen her business in order to become more competitive in the market and thus have the capacity to provide a higher quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and supplies wholesale (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner and nail polish amongst others) furniture and renovations to her shop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a known fruit vendor in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. She is 64 years old, a widow with adult children.

She is financially supported by Paglaum MPC in her business activities. As well, she receives financial literacy training in order to be more successful in managing her business.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is a 22-year-old student at Kenyatta University in Nairobi -- she is in her 4th year of her Bachelors degree in Education.

Evalyn is the eldest in her family and comes originally from the Machakos district, in central Kenya. Her family is proud of her achievement of getting into university and of her ambition to one day continue on to a Masters degree. After school, she is interested in going into business: she explained that ‘my father is currently a business man and I admire him and his job’.

Evalyn’s Kiva loan will pay for her tuition fees.

Please help her achieve her dreams by contributing to her loan today.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her final year at university.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking mother in Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She's doing her best to provide the needs of her family especially the education of her children, who are now in college.

Nida has an ardent desire to send all her children to school because she doesn't want her children to experience back-breaking jobs that she has endured.

Nida is lucky that she found Paglaum MPC where she is supported financially in her business activities. Recently, she availed another loan, which she used to purchase more stocks of fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to resell.

loans.name: Nel

texts.en:
Nel is 39 years old and single. He lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is a skilled fisherman who pushes his abilities in his fishing activities so that he can provide for the needs of his parents, knowing that they are already old.

He has also managed his membership with the cooperative, and it is evident that he doesn't have default payments. Recently, he availed himself of a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy new fishing nets. He believes having new nets for fishing would mean more catch of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a fish vendor from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old and married with school-age children.

She personally sells the catch of her fisherman husband. She also buys the catch of other fishermen for bigger profit. Recently, she availed herself of a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy more fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Cooking pallatable dishes has been the life of Felisa, who is 50 years old, married, and living in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Felisa has a growing number of customers who know that every day she offers mouth-watering dishes at a very reasonable price.

Felisa is supported by Paglaum MPC in doing this type of business. She has availed a loan from the cooperative to purchase more kilos of meat, spices, condiments and other items for her food-vending business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat, spices, condiments and other items for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Mil John

texts.en:
Mil John is 22 years old and single. He lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. At his young age, he has ventured into various businesses such as a fishing operation, retailing, rent and farming. He has two people who work for him in his businesses.

He wanted to be so productive at a very young age that he was too eager to invest in business. Recently, he availed himself of a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bags of fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Luz es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
Ella prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Sincelejo, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.
Trabaja sola durante 6 horas todos los días.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
Con estos elementos el podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Luz's perseverance and courage, her household can have a decent life.

She prepares and sells fast food in the town of Sincelejo, which she started doing because she was looking for new ways to support her family. She works alone for six hours every day.

Her husband and children are her main motivation for working hard and trying to be better every day.

She hopes to be able to propel her business forward with the purchase of supplies and raw materials, and this boost can be given by the Corporación Interactuar and Kiva loans. With these things, she will be able to have food available to her clients at all times.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same place so that she doesn't lose her clients.

loans.use: buy supplies and raw materials to make fast food.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Milena, con 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, un visionaria y buena negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo cosméticos en el municipio de Fresno y, desde hace 4 años tiene su propio negocio.  
Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Milena acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido de ropa, cosméticos, accesorios y productos para el cuidado personal para venderlo a través de catálogos, además de comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos. 

Milena es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  

La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Milena, 41, lives with her partner.  She is a responsible, hard-working businesswoman and has long made a living retailing products in her home town of Fresno.  

Milena started her own cosmetics sales business 4 years ago and says that she knows what it takes to overcome hard times.  Her goals for the future are to firmly establish her business and to buy a house of her own.  

Milena is applying for a loan to ensure that her business can stand the test of time.  She wants to buy clothing, cosmetics and other catalog merchandise that she will resell, along with a display case for displaying what she sells.  

This investment will further Milena's efforts to provide her family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her personal products sales business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 64-year-old widow from Panalsalan, Misamis Occidental. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC and also actively participated in the activities of the cooperative.

She managed her membership well, and it is evident that she doesn't have default payments. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 64 years old and a widow with three adult-aged children from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC and actively participants in programs of Paglaum that aim to develop members holistically.

She also managed her accounts with the cooperative without records of default. This time, she avails a loan to redeem pawned cocoland.

loans.use: to redeem pawned cocoland

loans.name: Porferio

texts.en:
Porferio is 74 years old and married. He is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He runs a fish vending business that is his primary source of income.

Recently, he availed himself of a loan to buy construction materials such as hollow blocks and bags of cement and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as hollow blocks and bags of cement and to pay for labor.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Enrique Voltaire

texts.en: Enrique Voltaire raised his family through his retailing business in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He signed up for membership to Paglaum MPC to access his initial capitalization. This time, because he needs to restock his store with consumable goods for retail, he asks for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods for retail

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Micheal Talle

texts.en:
Micheal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Micheal is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Micheal would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Micheal will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Micheal now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia has been operating her retail store for almost 20 years. Her business has existed up to this time through the financial assistance of Paglaum MPC and the financial literacy training that she learned from the cooperative.

Through this knowledge, she was able to properly manage her income and save well for future emergencies. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, detergent bars and powder, shampoo, bath soaps and others.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, detergent bars and powder, shampoo, bath soaps and others.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Tulia Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Tulia tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.
Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm
Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar algunas remodelaciones y mejoras locativas a su negocio.
El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podra trabajar de manera más cómoda

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas y restaurantes en la región.
texts.en:
Tulia has a great amount of experience in the field of baking. Some time ago she started her own bakery which has generated good results up to now. She has always preferred to work independently. She works every day from 8 am until 9pm.

Currently she needs help to carry out some renovations and improvements to her business. The loan allow her to work in better conditions and be able to work more comfortably.

Her big dream is to be able to have a large bakery that supplies and restaurants.

loans.use: to make some renovations and improvements to her shop.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es un hombre viudo de 48 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo en la localidad rural de Achoma, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a trabajos múltiples como peonaje agrícola, agricultura y cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en su alimentación, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; además, Pedro se dedica al cultivo de arveja orgánica, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de arveja chinchucho y abonos orgánicos para poder preparar el terreno donde planea cultivar dicho producto. En el futuro Pedro desea brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro, 48, is a widower.  He lives with his son in Achoma, a rural part of Arequipa.  He makes a living doing farm work and has a farm of his own where he grows beans and keeps cattle.  He takes a lot of care with his cattle and only feeds them organically-grown alfalfa from his farm. He also grow organic beans and is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs for his next bean crop.  We asked him about his hopes for the future and he told us that he wants to provide his son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Marleny Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Marleny es una veterana de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Tierra Alta y es viuda.

Es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la preparación de quesos y cuajadas. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas sola.

Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su edad y que le ha permitido sobrevivir.
Ella solicita un préstamo para compra de lácteos en gran cantidad.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para su subsistencia.
texts.en:
Marleny has been through thousands of battles in her life. She lives in the municipality of Tierra Alta and is a widow.

She is a very hardworking woman and for some time she has been working in the business of preparing cheeses and cottage cheeses.
She works alone everyday for 8 hours.

She sais that it is a sensible job for her to do at her age and it has allowed her to survive. The loan is for buying dairy products in bulk.
The loan will give her an opportunity to capitalise her business and give a considerable boost to her work, allowing her to earn resources for her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy dairy products in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Nelly

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 30 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Hace varios años se dedica a la cría, engorde y comercialización de pollos, idea que surgió como una alternativa para generar ingresos económicos, trabaja sola todos los días durante arduas jornadas, pues al mismo tiempo que está realizando su labor, también debe cuidar de sus hijos, lo que le acarrea grandes desafíos; sin embargo, con esfuerzo, amor y mucha dedicación ha logrado cumplir sus objetivos y generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica de toda la familia. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar adecuaciones al galpón y para comprar pollos para engorde y posterior venta; esto le permitirá optimizar más el espacio que posee y así incrementar la producción que se reflejará en mejores ventas, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año en la que se incrementa el consumo de esta carne. 

Luz sueña con poder darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de ingresos para así estar en la capacidad de seguir apoyando a sus hijos ofreciéndoles la oportunidad de realizar estudios universitarios para que tengan un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Luz, at 30 years old, is married and the mother of four children.  Many years ago, she began raising and selling chickens, an idea that came about as an alternative way of generating economic income.  She only works every day during the busy seasons, since at the same time she has to take care of her children, which carries with it great challenges.  However, with effort, love, and a lot of dedication, she has been able to complete her goals and generate sufficient resources to support her husband with the economic responsibility for the whole family. 

Currently, she is requesting the support of a loani in order to make improvements to the chicken coop and to purchase chickens to raise and then sell.  This will allow her to better optimize the space she has and thus increase her production, which will result in more sales, especially in this season at the end of the year, when the consumption of this type of meat increases. 

Luz dreams of being able to continue her work, generating income so that she has the capacity to continue supporting her children, offering them the opportunity to study at the university, so that they have a more prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to make improvements to the chicken coop and to purchase chickens to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 45-year-old, Lebanese, single woman living with her parents and one sibling. Her mother works as farmer to fulfill her family's needs. Since 2011, she decided to open her own beauty salon in her town in order to take on some of the responsibilities with her mother.

Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy beautician tools. This will increase her revenues. In the future, she plans to expand more her work.

loans.use: to buy beautician tools.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is 55 years old, a mother of six, living in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband's income comes from driving a motorcycle to transport passengers in neighboring barangays and cities. Severina took out a loan for the repair of the said motorcycle. She's three years into this business. Her future plan is to purchase another unit for additional income.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle for their transportation business.

loans.name: Jovelene

texts.en:
Jovelene is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old and is married with one child. Jovelene owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport services.

She has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Jovelene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovelene is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle in order to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor for repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Ann is 20 years old and is fourth of five children in the family. Her mother, Teresita, supports the family through her food vending and clothing retail businesses in the Philippines.

Ann is studying for a Bachelors degree in Elementary Education and is currently on her fourth year of this 4-year course.

Teresita is borrowing Php 7,200 to pay tuition fees for her daughter Ann, for the 2nd semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Ann plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Jenny dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marina Raquel

texts.es:
Marina tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado, se casó de 18 años y 22 años después quedo viuda, tiene 5 hijos y ya todos son mayores de edad y solo vive con 3 nietos y una de sus hijas.


El  negocio de que desempeña Marina es la venta de tamales pizques y de gallina dos veces por semana y también a lavar ropa ajena, además hoy también se dedica a la compra de pescado para revender,  es una mujer luchadora y su hija es quien le ayuda en las actividades que realiza. 


El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar hieleras para mantener en buen estados los mariscos que  venden.


El Sueño de Marina es construir el piso de la casa des pues de haber instalado la energía eléctrica y el agua potable. poco a poco quiere tener todos sus servicios y espera poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Marina, 52, left school after the fourth grade.  She married when she was 18 and was widowed at 40.  She has 5 children, all grown, and lives with a daughter and 3 grandchildren now.  

Marina does many jobs to make ends meet.  She makes and sells tamales, takes in laundry and buys and sells seafood.  Her daughter helps her with the work.  

Marina is applying for a loan that she will use to buy ice chests for keeping seafood.  

Marina would like to lay a floor for her house, but she wants electricity and water services first.

loans.use: to buy ice chests for keeping the seafood that she sells.

loans.name: Yonys Yomar

texts.es:
Yonys es un campesino de 50 años de edad, que desde muy pequeño aprendió a realizar las labores del campo gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres quienes han sido agricultores y jornaleros durante su vida. 

Hoy en día posee su propio cultivo de yuca, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en el mercado de la región, adicionalmente y, para complementar sus ingresos, realiza trabajos como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región. Su empuje, tenacidad y dinamismo lo llevan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), que son necesarios para preparar la tierra y así poder sacar una cosecha mucho más productiva, que le permita vender a mejor precio y así aumentar el margen de utilidades. 

Yonys solo desea darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de recursos, pues es feliz haciendo su labor y, en un futuro desea ampliar sus cultivos para generar oportunidades de empleo que le permitan mejorar no sólo su calidad de vida, sino también la de otros vecinos del sector.
texts.en:
Yonys is a 50 year old farmer. From a young age he learned to carry out farming work thanks to the teachings of his parents who have been farmers and day workers during his life.

Now he has is own yucca crop which he harvests, collects and sells in the market of the region. Additionally, and to complement his income, he works as a day worker in different farms in the region. His drive, tenacity and dynamism cause him to look for new alternatives which help him to get ahead in life. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertiliser, and other things) which are necessary to prepare the ground and thus be able to yield a more productive harvest allowing him to sell at a better price and thus increase his profit margins.

Yonys only wants to give continuity to his work as it generates his resources and he is happy doing his work. In the future he hopes to increase his crops in order to generate employment opportunities which will allow him to improve not only his quality of life but that of other neighbours in the area.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertiliser, and other things).

loans.name: Oscar Dario

texts.es:
Oscar encuentra en sus pollos esa oportunidad que siempre ha soñado de poder pagar una educación de calidad para sus hijos y tener el sustento diario para sobrevivir.
Hoy en día se siente muy orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora gracias a su dedicación, esfuerzo y trabajo duro.

Solicita un crédito para compra los materiales necesarios para la adecuación del galpón de sus pollos, además de comprar algunos pollos para la cría y gallinas ponedoras.

Es una actividad realizada con todo el cariño y empeño que solo un padre puede tener.
texts.en:
In his chickens Oscar found the opportunity he had always dreamed of, to pay for a quality education for his children and have the daily sustenance to survive.

Today he feels very proud of what he has been able to build up to now with his dedication, effort and hard work.

He is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to adapt the enclosure for his chickens, plus buy chickens to raise and some laying hens.

This is an activity carried out with all the love and determination that only a father can have.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to adapt the enclosure for his chickens, plus buy chickens to raise and some laying hens.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 46-year-old, married woman who lives with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She started her job in 2000 and opened a studio in her town. She works so hard to earn extra income in order to develop her life. Her customers are so glad with the results they obtained from her.

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new camera to better serve her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her work by opening a new branch.

loans.use: to purchase a new camera.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is known in her area through her cosmetics and beauty products business. She finds joy in doing this type of business because aside from it being her hobby to beautify herself, she's also making good sales through this business.

She wanted to expand her business through the loan products that she avails from Paglaum MPC. The amount that she borrows shall be spent to purchase additional cosmetic products, fragrances and other products for direct selling.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetic products, fragrances and other products for direct selling.

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en: Dulcisima is 90 years old, a widow from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, and a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC. She is grateful for the services of the cooperative and that, even at her age, she can still avail herself of its financial services. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to pay for a medical check up and to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.use: to pay for a medical check up and to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella monto un café internet desde hace varios años y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Ella tiene 41 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos elementos como una fotocopiadora y un pc. Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman with good ideas and a creative mind. She is always trying to look for activities to increase her family income.



She started an internet cafe a few years ago and she also sells some stationary items in the same business.



She is 41 years old and is ready to face the challenges that life has in store for her.



She is asking for a loan to buy some items such as a photocopier and a pc. With this money she will be able to invest in her business and attract more customers thus impacting on her profits in a positive way.



Her biggest dream is to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy things items such as a photocopier and a pc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorena is 40 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Lorena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and to pay for maintenance for her business.

Lorena has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Rawda

texts.en:
Rawda is a 35-year-old, single woman. She lives with her parents. Due to the bad financial conditions, she decided to start her own work in 2012 from her home, where she offers a great variety of new and used clothes at good prices.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales, and therefore, her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old, Lebanese, single man living with his parents and three siblings. Ali is the main income source in his family and he is doing well so far.

Today, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his brother’s educational fees. He states that this loan will help him to ensure a good education for his brother and his school year.

loans.use: to pay his brother’s educational fees.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalie is 50 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Rosalie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her local market.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her local market.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, juice, snack foods and other personal care products. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Carmen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, juice, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: La Vie Group

texts.fr: Munyelekwa est une vaillante femme, propriétaire d’un dépôt, où elle vend de la boisson dans le centre commercial depuis 13ans, trésorière du groupe solidaire «La Vie», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Elle va s’approvisionner en 110 caisses de Primus.  Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son mari qui est cambiste. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en: Munyelekwa is a hard-working woman. She owns a warehouse  in a commercial center  and she has been selling beverages for 13 years. She is the treasurer of the "La Vie" [Life] solidarity group and a customer of IMF Hekima. She is 37 years, married and has four children, who are in school. She will stock 110 cases of Primus beer. She launched her business thanks to funds received from her husband, a reseller. To conclude, Munyelekwa thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to stock 110 cases of beer.

loans.name: Medarda Maria

texts.es:
Medarda, una campesina de 28 años de edad, es madre de una hija de 10 años.
Nació en el seno de una familia humilde que encontró en la agricultura y el cuidado de animales una forma de vida, sus padres le enseñaron desde pequeña a realizar todas las tareas del campo y, gracias a eso, hoy en día posee algunos cultivos y además cría y comercializa pollos y cerdos; así ha logrado generar ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más lechones e insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y concentrado para animales), esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y por lo tanto aumentarán los ingresos por la venta de animales y la cosecha recolectada.

Medarda manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando hasta que Dios y su cuerpo se lo permitan, pues le gusta ser productiva y apoyar económicamente a su hija; así podrá disfrutar más delante de una vejez sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Medarda is a 28 year old farmer and the mother of a ten year old daughter.

Born into a humble family that found a way of life in agriculture and raising animals. Her parents taught her since she was young to carry out all the farm work and thanks to this today she has crops and also raises and sells chickens and pigs. She has managed to generate sufficient income to provide sustenance for her household.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more piglets and agricultural inputs wholesale (manure, fertilizer, pesticides and concentrated feed for her animals). This will allow her to increase her production and thus increase her income through the sale of the animals and her harvest.

Medarda says that her greatest wish is to continue to work as long as God and her body permit, as she likes to be productive and support her daughter economically. Doing this in the future she can enjoy her old age with no concerns.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and agricultural inputs wholesale (manure, fertilizer, pesticides and concentrated feed for animals)

loans.name: Yeison Janer

texts.es:
Yeison ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.

Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo pipetas de gas residencial, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para su hijo.

Le dedica 12 horas diarias a su negocio.

El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en el alquiler y remodelación de su propio local.
Con este préstamo podrá tener sus productos en una bodega organizados y podría ir avanzando como empresario.

Es un hombre fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Yeison has been through much hardship in the process of developing his business.



He currently lives in a modest house and he earns a living selling residential gas canisters. He learned this work empirically with the desire to earn sustenance for his child.



He dedicates 12 hours a day to his business.



He is asking for a loan to invest in renting and remodelling his own premises.

With this loan he will be able to have his products organised in a cellar and will be able to move forward as a businessman.


He is a strong man with a big entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to rent and remodel his own premises.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es:
Alba es una campesina de 41 años de edad, que se ha dedicado a realizar las tareas del campo para ganarse la vida, trabaja como ama de casa y de manera independiente posee cultivos cuyas cosechas recolecta y vende  el mercado del pueblo donde reside; así genera los recursos para solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar.

Con el crédito que solicita comprará insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), con los que continuará cuidando sus cultivos y podrá tener una cosecha mucho más productiva, generando un incremento en las ventas y por ende las utilidades que recibe.

Alba manifiesta que su único objetivo es seguir trabajando para mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida y poder continuar con sus cultivos, para que le generen el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Alba, 41, is a housewife and earns an income doing farm work.  She has land of her own, as well, and sells what she grows in the small town where she lives.  Her income just covers her family's basic needs.  

Alba is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies--fertilizer, pesticides, etc.--for planting and tending her next crop.  The investment will increase her chances of a good yield from her next harvest and, in turn, bring in a higher income.  

Alba tells us that her only goal is to continue working so that, little by little, she can improve her quality of life and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel es un campesino humilde y carismático, que ha luchado incansablemente para salir adelante.

Sus padres le enseñaron desde pequeño a realizar todas las tareas del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de yuca, ñame y plátanos; además cría y comercializa ganado y cerdos, la cosecha y los animales son vendidos en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, así genera los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia.

El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en el fortalecimiento de su negocio, con el dinero comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y concentrado para animales), esto le permitirá tener una cosecha mucho más productiva y mejorará el precio de venta de sus productos, aumentando así el ingreso que recibe por su labor.

Miguel manifiesta que su principal interés es seguir realizando sus labores, pues se han convertido en su única fuente de ingresos y además le gusta hacerlo, sólo espera poder seguir velando por el bienestar de su grupo familiar y más adelante, tener la capacidad para disfrutar una vejez tranquila y sin ningún tipo de preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Miguel is a humble and charismatic farmer, who has worked indefatigably to get by. 

His parents taught him as a small child to complete all the farming tasks, and thanks to their teachings, he currently cultivates yucca, yams and plantain. He also raises and sells cattle and pigs. The crop harvest and the animals are sold in the market of the village where he lives and that's how he generates sufficient income to meet the basic expenses of his family.

The requested loan will be invested in strengthening his business by purchasing agricultural supplies (manure, pesticides, fertilizers and concentrated animal feed) at wholesale. That will increase the income generated by his labor, by making the crop more productive and increasing the sales price of his products.

Migues expresses that his main interest is to continue with his labors, because they have become his only source of income and furthermore he enjoys his work. He just hopes to continue watching out for the well-being of his family and in the future enjoy a peaceful worry-free old age.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies at wholesale (fertilizer, pesticides, manure and feed concentrate for animals.)

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y es padre de dos niños, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas.

Alfredo, desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño a trabajar en el campo y otras áreas de esa misma actividad, cuando se acompañó siempre siguió trabajando con su padre; pero hace 3  años le ofrecieron un trabajo como fontanero en una cooperativa de agua y su labor es cuidar la maquinaria mientras está encendida; su turno inicia a las 3 de la madrugada y a las 8 de la noche, a veces lo hace 3 a 4 veces por semana.

Alfredo, necesita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse hasta su lugar de trabajo, porque a esas horas de la madrugada que el sale de su casa, no hay transporte y tiene que caminar bastante.

Él, sueña con comprar bovinos de repasto, porque su tío tiene un terreno donde los puede pastar y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Alfredo, age 27, studied until the ninth grade. He lives with his partner, and he is the father of two children. His partner devotes herself to the household duties and also helps him with the farm work.

When Alfredo was very young, his father taught him how to work in the fields, and other aspects of this occupation, and when he moved in with his partner he continued as always, working with his father. But, three years ago, they offered him a job as a plumber in a water cooperative. His work is taking care of the machinery while it is running. His shift starts at three in the morning and eight at night, and sometimes he does this three or four times a week. Alfredo needs the loan in order to purchase a motorcycle to get to his place of work, because there is no transportation in the morning hours in which he leaves for work, and he has to walk for quite a while.

He dreams of purchasing grazing cattle because his uncle has a field where they can graze, and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle in order to travel to his place of work.

loans.name: Anancy

texts.en:
Arancy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa to sell.

Arancy has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Arancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es:
Miguel nació en el seno de una familia humilde campesina que encontró en las labores agrícolas una alternativa de vida y fue allí donde aprendió todo lo que hoy sabe en el manejo de cultivos y cría de animales.

A sus 68 años de edad, posee un cultivo de platano, además cría y comercializa pollos, trabaja sola todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana y la producción de platanos y de pollos es vendida en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside, así logra generar los ingresos que le permitan sobrevivir.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su oficio, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes) así logrará aumentar la producción y podrá vender más, dando como resultado un incremento en los ingresos.

Miguel sueña con ampliar su negocio con más cultivos y ampliando su galpón, para mejorar los ingresos por ventas y garantizar una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Miguel was born into a modest farming family who worked in agriculture. It was an alternative form of life and it was here where he learned all that he knows today about managing crops and breeding animals.



At 68 years of age, he grows bananas and he also breeds and sells chickes. He works alone every day from the early hours of the morning and he sells the bananas and chickens in the market place of the municipality where he lives. This is how he manages to generate the income that allows him to survive.

With the drive to strengthen his work, he is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies (manure, pesticides, fertiliser) and in this way he will manage to increase production and will be able to sell more. This will result in an increase in income.



Miguel dreams of expanding his business with more crops and expanding his home, in order to increase his income through sales and guarantee economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, pesticides, fertilisers).

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has one child still in school.

Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, bread, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, bread, sugar and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Mirna Estela

texts.es:
Mirna de 34  años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, estudió hasta octavo grado ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir, sus dos hijos estudian y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Mirna  se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años, su madre le enseñó este oficio  ya que le iba a servir mucho para defenderse por si sola, es así como ahora tiene una tienda y es su principal fuente de ingresos.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar churros, gaseosas, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, papas, arroz, etc para surtir la tienda.


 Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 34, is a single mother of two children. She attended school until the eighth grade, as she did not have the opportunity to continue. Her two children are attending school, and are the only ones depending upon her.

Mirna has been working in retail for ten years. Her mother taught her this work, as it would serve her well in getting by on her own, and that is how she came to have a store today. It is her principal source of income.

She is requesting this loan to purchase churros, soft drinks, sugar, oil, beans, potatoes, rice, etc., in order to stock the store.

She dreams that her business may grow and that her children may attend school.

loans.use: to purchase churros, soft drinks, sugar, oil, beans, potatoes, rice, etc., in order to stock the store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 62 years old, married and lives with her three children in Capucao, Ozamis City. For years she has earned about 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month by farming. Growing coconuts is the main source of income and she also has a plot of corn and bananas. Every week, she was able to deliver harvested bananas to the market to earn a living. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure and for weeding maintenance. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to fertilize the land.

loans.name: Leonel Fernando

texts.es:
Leonel tiene 68 años de edad, es separado y padre de un hijo de 12 años. Desde hace 40 años se desempeña como agricultor independiente, actividad que aprendió de su familia cuando era pequeño, pues ha sido una tradición familiar que ha pasado de generación en generación. 

Actualmente posee cultivos de yuca y plátano, ubicados en un terreno familiar. Cuenta con el apoyo de un trabajador que emplea al jornal. 

El cliente es un hombre perseverante, activo y muy trabajador, siempre busca opciones que le permitan avanzar, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos externos como los altos costos de los insumos que requiere y el invierno que en varias ocasiones ha dañado sus cultivos, afectando directamente sus finanzas. 

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de semillas, abonos, riegos y fertilizantes que le permitan darle continuidad a su labor y sacar una cosecha más productiva, que pueda ser vendida a mejor precio en el mercado, aumentando sus ingresos de manera notable. 

Leonel desea cumplir sus metas, fortaleciendo su negocio para que sea más rentable y así mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonel is 68 years old, separated, and father of a 12-year-old son. For the last 40 years, he has worked as an independent farmer. He learned this occupation from his family when he was a child, since it is a family tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation.

Currently, he has yucca and plantain farms, located on family land. He also employs a day-laborer.

Leonel is a persistent, active, and hard-working man. He is always looking for options that will allow him to move forward, surpassing various external obstacles such as the high cost of the required inputs, and winters that have on several occasions damaged his crops, directly affecting his finances.

The loan that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds, manure, irrigation, and fertilizers. This will allow him to continue his work and achieve a more productive crop that can be sold at a better price in the market, increasing his income significantly.

Leonel wants to meet his goals, strengthen his business to make it more profitable and thus improve the quality of life and well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, irrigation, and fertilizers that permit him to continue his work.

loans.name: Frithes

texts.en:
Frithes is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, canned goods, etc. Janet has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Karla Cristina

texts.es:
Karla es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 17 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catálogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Karla y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Karla is a very enterprising woman, with a great desire to get ahead and progress.

Since the age of 17, she has been selling products by catalog, such as clothing, accessories, beauty items, and household goods. She mostly sells these products to friends, neighbors, and relatives who know Karla and also want her to progress in her occupation.

Ever since she was a little girl, she had a great affinity for commerce and sales, so today she has great abilities in this field, thanks to her friendliness and excellent quality of service.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a supply of beauty products and clothing in order to increase her inventory and improve her sales, thus earning a good income for her home.

She has the expectation of being able to get ahead, thanks to the support of good-hearted people who, along with Corporación Interactuar, support these kinds of projects.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of beauty products and clothing, in order to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 57 years old and has one child still in school. Elena has a pedicab transportation business in the Philippines. Elena requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for her pedicab and pay maintenance expenses for her pedicab transportation. Elena has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her pedicab and pay maintenance expenses for her pedicab transportation

loans.name: Menjie

texts.en:
Menjie is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 13 while the youngest is two. A year ago, she started selling RTW (ready-to-wear) like blankets, shirts, pants, foot wear and ladies apparel to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. To meet the needs of the entire family, she also raises and sells hogs.

She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.

Menjie has requested a loan to buy more stocks of RTW (ready-to-wear) and purchase piglets. In that way, she can continue to sell a variety of stocks and raise quality hogs. These are vital to her livelihood.

For the future, Menjie hopes that she can successfully manage her business to make it more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing and purchase piglets.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 45 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Maria Elena has been in this business for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 51 years old and has two children who are in school, Janette works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, eggs, milk, soap, chips, etc.

Janette has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Janette would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, eggs, milk, soap, and chips

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 53 years old and has four children. Emelda is married and all of her children are presently in school.

Emelda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Emelda requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Emelda has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ronalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ronalyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

Ronalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 57 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Ramon Nonato

texts.es:
Ramon ha sido un hombre trabajador y honrado, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 4 hijos y su esposa; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 15 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposa y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja solo todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productivo como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de productos naturistas para abastecer su local, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Ramon manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Ramón has been a hardworking and honorable man, always looking after the care of his family, which is composed of his four children and his wife. He has always liked working as an independent businessman, and he started selling merchandise 15 years ago, as he bears the financial responsibility for his home, along with his wife, and he needs to generate the resources to do so.

His customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends in the sector. He works alone everyday in his business, and in his work he has the advantage of being able to look after his family and be a productive businessman at the same time.

Currently, he is requesting the loan to purchase an assortment of natural products at wholesale, in order to stock his store, as it is a great opportunity in this season of the year. This will allow him to stock a greater variety, in order to satisfy the demand that increases during the Christmas season, resulting in better income for his family.

Ramón declares that his greatest desires are to be able to continue supporting his family financially, and to give an education to all his children in order to see them become professionals, so that they may have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of natural products at wholesale, in order to stock his store.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Саида молодая девушка. Ей 25 лет. Она после развода с мужем вернулась в родительский дом, взяв собой сыночка. 
После развода она начала новую жизнь. Она стала заниматься шитьем женской одежды. Саида работает дома, и параллельно ведет домашние хозяйство. Саида открыла в себе талант швеи. Она шьет разную и стильную одежды. Саида решила купить новую швейную машинку. Машинка улучшить процесс работы, это окажет влияние на качество ее работы, и привлечь себе больше клиентов. Из-за нехватки денег на новую машинку она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Saida is a young woman. She is 25 years old. After divorcing her husband, she returned to her parent's home with her small son. Saida started a new life after her divorce. She bagan sewing women's clothing. She works out of her home and also takes care of household tasks. Saida discovered that she is a gifted seamstress. She sews various stylish clothing. 

Saida decided to buy a new sewing machine, which will improve her work process and the quality of her work, and help her attract more customers. Since she is lacking funds to buy a new sewing machine, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 63 years old, married and has five children.

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business and support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail clippers, nail polish, a nail cutter and other materials for her business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail clippers, nail polish, a nail cutter and other materials for her business

loans.name: Maria Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita was able to sustain her small general store through the previous loans granted to her by Kiva and its lenders. She is thanking God for their good hearts. Her being a widow is her biggest challenge in life but with her positive outlook and love for her children she has managed to be victorious.

To help her expand her store, she is now seeking a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income and has sustained her family's personal and household needs. She is hoping for your positive response.

Nenita works hard and trusts God to continually prosper her business. She prays for good health for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jena works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her store. Jena is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy assorted dried fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Jena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old and married with four children, all of whom are currently in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Jennifer has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Tenez Bon Group

texts.fr: Kapinga est commerçante, membre du collectif de crédits «Tenez Bon», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 42 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui 3 étudient et 2 sont encore petits. Elle est vendeuse de friperies dans un marché périphérie de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en deux ballons de friperie. Elle débuta par le premier fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kaping is an entrepreneur, a member of the "Tenez Bon" [Keep it Up] borrower's group and a client of IMF Hekima. She is a widow, 42 years old, and the mother of five children, three of whom are in school and two are still very young. Kaping has been selling second-hand clothing at a market in the outskirts of her town for 12 years. 

She will buy two bales of used clothing. She launched her business thanks to initial funds received from her relatives. She would like to build a house and provide for her children's schooling and food. In conclusion, Kaping thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy two bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela is a married woman of 46. She lives in Badian, Cebu with her family. As a mother to six children aged six to fifteen, she works hard to provide for them. She sells coconut wine and also into buy and sell of mats. She is asking a loan to buy more gallons of coconut wine. With a loan, it will serve as an additional capital so she cater to the request of the locals for more coconut wine, thus increasing her revenue. In the future, Carmela plans to have another income source for her family's better life.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from poultry. Marilou is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jesusa works hard to support her family.

She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Jesusa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy assorted recycled materials to sell.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is a hardworking female entrepreneur with three children.

Jena earns a living by growing flowering plants in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, flower pots and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from food vending and her butcher shop.

Jena successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jena dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, flower pots and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is single and living with her family. She is a teacher, but she could not be assigned by the Ministry of Education. So, in order not to be a burden to her family, she started selling herbal tea. With the help of her loan she will buy herbal tea in bulk and sell it. She also wants to be assigned as a teacher.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Eda hanım bekar ailesi ile yaşıyor. Öğretmen fakat atanamadığından ailesine yük olmamak, kendi ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bitkisel çay satışı yapmaya başlamış. Aldığı ilk kredi ile ürün alıp satmaya başlayacak. Mesleğini de yapmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy herbal tea

loans.name: Kithimani S.a.upendo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Rose. She is 56 years old, married and has three children.
She runs a greengrocer kiosk to earn a living. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training she has acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her diversify the business and she has started selling fruit juice. Rose is taking a Kiva loan to purchase a juice blender that will enable her make enough fruit juice for her customers. She looks forward to more profits that will enable her cater for family needs.
Rose is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase a juice blender that will enable her make enough fruit juice for her customers.

loans.name: Wendi Witu Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Dorcas. She forty years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to gain skills and knowledge on how to manage her business. She operates a food kiosk and is borrowing a Kiva loan for the second time to add more stock of potatoes, cooking fat, rice and baking flour.
She hopes for more income that will enable her provide basic needs for her family such as school fees, food and clothing.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, cooking fat, rice and baking flour that will boost profits.

loans.name: Tsozi

texts.en:
Tsozi is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Tsozi operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall at the market where town dwellers and neighbors shop. She faces a challenge of high cost of theft in her place of operation.



With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Musa Kalle

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Dankwaire village. As a Babban Gona member, Musa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Musa can to store the maize he harvests and delay selling it until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Musa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.
