With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Musa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zakiru

texts.en:
Zakiru is a maize farmer from Kankanki village. As a Babban Gona member, Zakiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zakiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Zakiru can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Zakiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Zakiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en: Ursula is a 37 year old Lebanese married woman and mother of one child still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life. Despite the bad financial situation, she is requesting today a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him with the new school year what makes her very optimistic

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees

loans.name: Francisco Alpidio

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre campesino de 37 años de edad que, desde que era niño su padre le enseñó todas las labores agrícolas, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de arveja, papa criolla y fríjol, cuyas cosechas recolecta y vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. 

Su actitud emprendedora, dinamismo y las ganas de salir adelante lo motivan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan cumplir sus objetivos, por ello se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, entre otros), de esta manera podrá continuar con su labor, pues tendrá la posibilidad de recoger una cosecha más productiva y de buena calidad para que pueda ser vendida con mayor facilidad para recibir mejores ingresos y así, hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan por los altos costos de los insumos y por la inestabilidad en los precios de los productos. 

El principal anhelo de Francisco es continuar con su labor y poder ampliar sus cultivos para convertirse en un gran productor y que su negocio sea rentable para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable que le ayude a brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 37-year-old farmer, who as a young child, was taught all the work that has to do with farming by his father. Thanks to that, today he owns pea, creole potato, and bean crops, the harvests of which he gathers and sells in the market plaza of the municipality where he resides. In this way, he generates enough resources to provide for his home financially.

His enterprising attitude, dynamism, and desire to get ahead motivate him to seek new alternatives that will allow him to achieve his objectives, so he is requesting a loan, with which he wants to purchase wholesale agricultural supplies (seed, fertilizer, and pesticide, among other items).

In this way, he will be able to continue with his work, as he will have the possibility of a more productive, good quality harvest, that he may sell more easily in order to receive better income, and thus deal with the challenges presented by the high cost of supplies and the instability in the price of produce.

Francisco's biggest desires are to continue with his work and to be able to expand his crops in order to become a big producer. Also, that his business may be profitable, so that it will guarantee him the positive financial balance that will help him to provide his family with the best living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale agricultural supplies (seed, compost, fertilizer, and pesticide, among other items).

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet a resident of Kasese district operates a salon business for the last five years. She is doing great, and this has helped her to run her household expenses. She desires to have a model salon that can offer bridal services and she is working hard towards her dream.

The only difficulty in her business is that she buys braids and weaves from other people yet she would be making income if she had her own. Janet is requesting for money to buy more hair pieces and chemicals for using in the salon.

loans.use: to buy more hair pieces and chemicals for using in the salon.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge owns cows, sheep and goats, he sells his cows' milk and cultivates a corn field. His wife used to be exposed to the toxic smoke produced by burning wood several hours per day while she was cooking, exposing her to to the risk of generating respiratory illnesses. She also spent several hours per week collecting wood in the surroundings, while the household was spending money on LP gas and chemical fertilizers.

Jorge and his family decided to invest in a biodigester to reduce the contamination linked with their farming activity and to reduce their expenses. By inputting their animals' manure into the biodigester, they will treat it and produce renewable energy (biogas) to cook and heat water, as well as a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer for their corn field. They will live in a cleaner, more sustainable environment, while saving money and improving their productivity. With his savings, Jorge plans to buy poultry and improve the stable where he keeps his animals.

This loan represents 18% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a down payment from the client.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Hauwa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing her dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona 
Hauwa can store her maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Hauwa has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Hauwa is thankful that she no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve her yield and looks forward to using her additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 22 year Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and five siblings, three of them are still studying. She’s really proud of her family and ready to do her best to be able to offer them a respectable life. Since she noticed that her father’s income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own clothing shop. Today, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to cover her brother’s educational fees.

loans.use: to cover her brother’s educational fees

loans.name: Mierna

texts.en: Mierna is 59 years old, married and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She runs and operates a fishing business that primarily provides the needs of her family. She is supported by her loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount of PHP 15,000.00 that she asks from the cooperative shall be used to buy materials for fishing boat making such as plywood, bronze nails, sealant, and motor engine.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing boat making such as plywood, bronze nails, sealant, and motor engine

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en: Elaine is 46 years old, a widow from Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is a fish retailer in their place. She is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC through its loan products. Recently, she avails a loan to buy more stock of fish for resell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for reselling.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rutchel is 33 years old and has two children are still in school.

Rutchel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rutchel requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rutchel has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Jovita is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 44 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of growing tea and dairy farming which he has been doing for seven years now and he has a vision of gaining an income for his family to alleviate poverty. He faces challenges of droughts and price fluctuation that destroy growth of his business. However, Gerald has a vision of working extra hard to alleviate poverty in his family. Gerald has asked for a loan to help him buy tea seedlings and planting a new field and fertilizer and manure for the tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for a new field and fertilizer and manure for the tea plantation.

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en: Rocela a 35yrs of age already married and having a three children her husband was a tricycle driver. He had support the family's daily needs with this income from their retail store.  Recently, he took a new loan to buy some additional goods for her sari-sari store, and a portion to buy additional materials to renovate her retail store business. He plans to buy another equipment for their food processing business to the purpose of having an extra income.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ailyn is 34 years old and has one child still in school.

Ailyn has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Ailyn requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional personal care products like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap, make up kit and other personal care products.

Ailyn has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal care products like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap, make up kit and other personal care products

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amy is 44 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Amy has a food vending business in the Philippines. Amy requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business.

Amy has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 24 years old and married with two children, one child still in school, Anelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Anelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Anelyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Anelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling dried fish.

Imelda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is maize farmer from Fulani village. As a member of Babban Gona, Lawal is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Lawal is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ruchelle

texts.en:
Ruchelle is 33 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Ruchelle has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Many people in the Southern part of Cebu relies on weaving mats for a living. Mats are colorful and cool to the skin. It is used for sleeping in many households, just like a mattress in other parts of the world. Marites is into buying and selling of mats in the community of Badian, Cebu.

She also owns and operates a Sari-sari store business for an income. She is asking for
a loan to buy merchandise for her store such as tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap. She will also use the loan to buy rice for family consumption. Her profit will be spent on her ten-year-old daughter's school fees.

loans.use: to buy tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap and rice for family consumption

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 40 years old and married with four children, one child still in school. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 52 years old and married with five children, one child still in school, Ethel works very hard to provide for them.

Ethel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Ethel has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future Ethel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Arjie

texts.en:
Arjie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arjie is 48 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Arjie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arjie requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like banana, sugar, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

Arjie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like banana, sugar, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Shu'aibu

texts.en:
Shaáibu is a maize farmer from Ranau village. As a Babban Gona member, Shaáibu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Shaáibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Shaáibu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Shaáibu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Shaáibu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is single with one child and has a buy and sell spare parts business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy more motor spare parts like engine oil, tire and other spare parts to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more motor spare parts like engine oil, tire and other spare parts to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 59 years old and widowed with three children. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Helen has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Lucía Esperanza

texts.es:
Lucia estudió hasta el segundo grado, ya que los padres no le permitieron seguir en la escuela, está casada, el esposo se dedica a las ventas de artículos de uso diario en los pueblos cercanos, juntos tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales tres trabajan y uno estudia, en casa solo viven dos de sus hijos.


Lucia se dedica a la venta de plantas, en el vivero tiene plantas frutales, de sombra, rosales y otras variedades de plantas para decoración, ella se ha dedicado a la venta de plantas desde hace ya 32 años, esto lo aprendió de la cuñada y a ella le gustaban las ventas y por ello decidió dedicarse a este negocio, antes  ella trabajaba como empleada doméstica en la ciudad, ya que la madre le exigía que trabajara, Lucia tiene el vivero en la casa en donde vende las plantas a turistas que vistan el pueblo.


Ella necesita este crédito para comprar plantas para el vivero como: frutales, rosales, árboles para sombra, plantas colgantes, etc. Y con esto logrará tener suficientes mercadería para la venta, obteniendo de esta forma más ingresos para la familia.


Lucia sueña con tener un vivero con una mayor variedad de plantas para que las personas que las compran tengan de donde elegir la que más le guste.
texts.en:
Lucia has only a grade 2 education as her parents didn't allow her to continue in school. She is married, and her husband sells items in daily use in the nearby towns. They have four children, three of whom work and the fourth is in school. Only two of their children still live at home.

Lucia earns her living selling plants. In her nursery she has fruit bushes, shade plants, rose bushes and other decorative varieties. She's had this business for 32 years and learned it from her sister-in-law. She loves selling things so she decided to go into sales. Beforehand she was a maid in town as her mother insisted that she had a job. Lucia runs her business from her home and sells to tourists who visit the town.

She needs this loan to buy plants for her nursery, plants such as fruit trees, rose bushes, shade trees, hanging plants etc. With these purchases she will have enough stock to earn more money for her family.

Lucia's dream is to have a nursery with a greater variety of plants so that her customers have a wide variety from which to choose what they most like.
.

loans.use: buy plants for her nursery such as fruit trees, rose bushes, shade trees, hanging plants etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 52 years old and separated with one child resides at Kinangay Norte, Clarin. She owns and operates for rent a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been in the business for many years and earns 6,000 PHP per month. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying tires and accessories for her motor. She is now taking anew loan to renewal of license and buy a new brake pad for her motorcycle for a safe travel with costumers. Lorna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for license renewal.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 63 years old, single and has seven children.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Imelda has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 37 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural, pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jona is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jona has been in this business for two years and earns additional income from Nipa roof making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and has three children. Josephine is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Julio Dario

texts.es:
Julio es un campesino del oriente antioqueño, soltero y sin hijos.  Aprendió las labores del campo, gracias a su hermano mayor y cuando era joven trabajaba como agricultor en diferentes fincas de la región, pero decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, una curtiembre con la que ha generado los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar, sin embargo, con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos que recibe, desea reiniciar su actividad de agricultor y quiere iniciar su cultivo con una siembra de  arveja en un terreno arrendado; es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas); de esta manera podrá generar mejores ingresos. 

Julio desea trabajar arduamente para llegar a cumplir el sueño de tener un terreno propio en el que pueda sembrar sus cultivos y disminuir los costos de producción, lo que le permitirá tener la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Julio lives in the countryside in the Antioquian west. He is single and does not have any children. He learned how to work the land, thanks to his older brother, and when he was young he worked as a farmer in different farms in the region. However, he decided to become independent and start his own business - a tannery through which he has generated the necessary income to bring sustenance to his home. However, with the goal of supplementing his income, he wants to start working as a farmer again, and he wants to start farming by planting peas on rented land. It is for this reason that he wants to request a loan, which he will use to buy agricultural inputs on wholesale (seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides). This way, he will be able to generate more income. Julio wants to work hard to achieve his dream of having his own land where he can plant his crops and lower the cost of production. This will allow him to have the opportunity to improve his living conditions and his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs on wholesale (seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides).

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Rionegro, Antioquia, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de un kit de manicure y pedicura, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Juliana a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
In her ceaseless search for a better life and more financial stability, Juliana runs a nail and hair business, attending people in their own homes in the municipality of Rionegro, Antioquia. It's a town where drive and initiative are very important to the local people.

Juliana works every day but has no fixed schedule. She's always busy since her clients seek her out for the good service she provides.

She is seeking a small loan to buy a manicure and pedicure kit so she can better serve her clients and keep her business afloat. Today she is pleased with the service she provides as it has enabled her to enjoy a more stable work situation. With a loan you will be able to support Juliana to achieve her life goals!

loans.use: buy a manicure and pedicure kit

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a married woman. She is 65 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jessie has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jessie requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dry good products, such as bags, belts, cups, etc. to resell in her stall.

Jessie has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry good products, such as bags, belts, and cups to resell in her stall.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jennie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell peanut business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Jennie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of peanuts to resell to her customers.

Jennie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of peanuts to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Lota

texts.en:
Lota is a married woman, 55 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lota has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Lota has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 53 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, noodles, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, noodles, snack foods, and shampoo

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Miguela is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to resell in her food stall, for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Miguela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell in her food stall.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming rice. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle service business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of one school-age child, Bernadith works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a manicure-pedicure service. Bernadith is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell for her buy-and-sell nipa roofing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Bernadith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional nipa roofing to sell for her  buy-and-sell nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, a farmer with a husband and three children, lives in Chor village, which is far from a power grid. Beside farming, she and her husband sell wood to villagers to build houses.

As a farmer and also a businesswoman, Saran wants to expand her business with a ten hectare sized land and help her family live in comfortable conditions. However, her house has no reliable energy source.

She has to go to charge a car battery every two or three days for daily usage. Sometimes because of business, she doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family is in a pitch black condition for the whole day.

As a result, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, she believes her family's condition would be better and safer. She also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prey Sampov Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe E

loans.name: Roseland

texts.en:
Roseland was born and raised in Mount Holly, NJ. She started Quality Extensions from her home a few years ago after being disappointed over and over at salons in her area. For many years, Roseland would go to hair salons to get hair extensions and leave unsatisfied – she found the quality of the hair was low and the salons charged a premium for it.

Roseland buys good quality hair in bulk and hires retirees and welfare recipients from her neighborhood to offer a better service for a fraction of the cost of a salon. Roseland is especially proud that she can run a business that employs members of her local community.

A Kiva loan from you will help Roseland purchase a larger inventory of hair to meet the growing demand for her popular services. She plans to use a portion of the loan to update her website and conduct an online marketing campaign.

In addition to running her business, Roseland works part-time to support her family’s income. She is a home health aid for elderly individuals and a probation officer for the state of NJ. Roseland also makes time to be with her husband and raise her stepson.

loans.use: to buy high quality hair in bulk and update her website

loans.name: Manuel Esteban

texts.es:
Manuel, a sus 40 años de edad es padre de 7 hijos y vive en unión libre. 

Desde que era muy joven conoce la labor cría, engorde y comercialización de cerdos, así complementa sus ingresos, mientras que utiliza el espacio que tiene disponible en su finca. 

Los cerdos son vendidos luego de ser engordados, ya sea vivos o por kilos, dependiendo de los requerimientos que haga el cliente. Con el ánimo de aumentar su capital de trabajo y su producción, solicita el crédito para comprar lechones para engorde, que le permitan tener disponibilidad suficiente para satisfacer la demanda tan alta en la época decembrina que se aproxima, donde se aumentan las ventas de estos animales. De las dificultades que diariamente tiene que enfrentar, una de ellas es la falta de historial crediticio.

Manuel desea hacer de su negocio una actividad rentable, donde pueda tener una producción escalonada que le genere ingresos constantes y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
Manuel, who is 40 years old, is the father of 7 children and lives in a common law marriage. Since he was very young, he has been involved in raising, fattening, and selling pigs. This is how he supplements his income, while he uses the space that he has available in his farm. The pigs are sold after being fattened, either alive or by the kilo, depending on the customer's request.

With intentions of increasing his working capital and production, he is requesting a loan to buy suckling pigs to fatten. This will allow him to have enough supply to satisfy the very high demand this coming December, when sales of these animals increase. Of the difficulties that he has to face on a daily basis, one of them is a lack of credit history. Manuel wants to make his business a profitable activity, where he can have staggered production that will generate constant income, and in this manner improve his living conditions and the wellbeing of his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs to fatten, which will allow him to have sufficient supply.

loans.name: Dania

texts.en:
Dania was born in Puerto Rico. When she arrived in the U.S., she began providing manicure services while simultaneously keeping up with a full-time job. Her first clients were her mother, her sister, and her friends. It didn't take much time for word of mouth to spread outside of Piscataway, NJ, that Dania was an expert in nail art and treatments. She quit her job to run her business full-time due to the increasing demand and her growing customer base.

Dania has always dreamed of being her own boss. At an early age, she found joy in helping people look their best and would often create her own nail designs. Her main customers choose her services because of the unique nail art and treatment offerings. Some of her customers are older ladies that like Dania's attention to detail.

Her family is an integral part of her business. Her son is her personal handyman and fixes problems with her equipment. Her husband keeps the books for the business and her daughter runs all of her social media. A Kiva loan from you will help Dania conduct a winter marketing campaign and purchase the latest polish colors for this season. This loan will also help her build her personal credit.

loans.use: to achieve marketing goals and purchase inventory

loans.name: Kroeun

texts.en: Kroeun and his wife lives in TonSaong Thlak Village with three children. They have worked as farmers for over 40 years. Spending days and time raising three children, Kroeun wants to have a comfortable life. Currently, he is still farming while his three children have already started working in a factory. He and his wife are having difficulty in using a battery for home energy. He needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using his car battery, Kroeun decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy solar home energy.  He believes solar home energy can enhance his  lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Tonsaong Thlak Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Samb

loans.name: Keyla Ruby

texts.es:
Keyla es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus dos hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente unos meses inició la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Keyla busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Keyla tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Keyla!
texts.en:
Keyla is a person who has had to face many problems in her life. Nevertheless she has always had the strength to overcome them and make progress along with her two children.

A few months ago she started to look for ways to earn money. That was how she started to raise and sell chickens, a business which has come to generate an income with which she pays household expenses.

Keyla is seeking a loan to buy supplies for the chickens and repair the coop. She knows that with Corporación Interactuar's help she can succeed. She hopes that the loan will allow her to grow her business and make progress. She expects to earn more money so she can provide her children with a better standard of living and opportunities to progress.

With a loan to Keyla you will improve her life and business!

loans.use: buy supplies for her chickens and pay for repairs to the coop

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell herbal medicine business.

Cheryll dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 59 years old and married with four children. One child is still in school. Linda works very hard to provide for them.

Linda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Linda has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 59 years old, married and has three children.

Lucita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucita has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Deuany

texts.en:
Deuany is 34 years old and married with one child in school. Deuany works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products like shirts, bags, watches, etc. to sell.

Deuany has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Deuany would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like shirts, bags, and watches to sell.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 56 years old and married with seven children; one child is still in school. Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Mae has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 42 years old and has three children. Marieta is married and has three children currently in school.

Marieta is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marieta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marieta has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Sreyyeng

texts.en: Sreyyeng is 20 years old and a freshman student at a university. She is from Pursat Province in Cambodia. Her parents are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming for revenue. Due to a lack of finances, Sreyyeng would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees for four years. This loan will help her graduate and achieve her dreams. In the future she wants to be a biology teacher at a high school. She also wants to build a new house for her family and if she has children she wants her children to study to pursue bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees for four years

loans.name: Crizel

texts.en:
Crizel is 36 years old and married with one child who is in school. Crizel works very hard to provide for them.

Crizel has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Crizel has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soap and other groceries.

In the future, Crizel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 67 years old and single.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like spices, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell in her store .

Ofelia has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like spices, canned goods, and noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and single.

Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Sandra has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Sandra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 44 years old and has two children. Milagros is married and has two children who are still in school.

Milagros is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Milagros has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают сына. У Айгул - среднее образование, с 2010 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айгул на сегодняшний день есть 20 коров. Супруг Айгул во всем помогает по хозяйству. Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного поголовья коров племенной породы. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aigul is 27 and married with one son. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry since 2010 as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 20 cows on her farm. Her husband helps her with everything on the farm. 

Aigul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase additional purebred cattle. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional purebred cattle in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tessie is 52 years old and has one child still in school.

Tessie has a general store business in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
German es un hombre trabajador y humilde, cualidades que tiene muy bien merecidas ya que su labor de zapatero le han dado la oportunidad de conseguir el sustento para su familia.

Inicio este negocio hace 15 años a través de las enseñanzas de su padre quien le ofreció la oportunidad de aprender el oficio.

Hoy en día trabaja en la calle con unos ingresos bajos pero ganados con mucho esfuerzo.
Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materia prima como cuero, pega, clavos, entre otros, elementos que le permitirán abastecer su negocio y poder generar una mejor producción de calzado.

Ayuda a German a cumplir su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia a través de su trabajo
texts.en:
German is a hardworking and humble man - qualities that are very well deserved, since his work as a cobbler has given him the opportunity to obtain sustenance for his family. He started this business 15 years ago through his father's teachings, who offered him the opportunity to learn the trade.

Today, he works in the streets and has very low income, but he earns his income with a lot of hard work. He is requesting financial support to buy raw materials such as leather, glue, and nails, among other items. These things will let him stock his business and produce a better shoe. Help German achieve his dream of buying his own home through his work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, glue, and nails, among other items.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
For the last 35 years, Miguela has been in the business of buying and selling mats in the town of Badian, Cebu. This is her source of living from the community focusing on producing this kind of goods. Her husband also supports her by being the one to help in the delivery of mats.

She is asking for a loan as additional capital so she can buy more mats to sell at her place.

Her earnings will benefit her 13-year-old child, who is attending school. In the future, she hopes to reach more areas where she can sell her mats for increased business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more mats.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
For the past three years, Luisa has been into a vegetable vending business. She sells vegetables such as squash, beans, eggplant, ampalaya (bitter gourd), pechay, and other green leafy vegetables, serving neighbors and town dwellers in her place. In addition to that, she also operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities such as coffee, sugar, cooking oil, powdered milk, bath soap, and condiments.

She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is 22, and the youngest is 9. Most of her expenses come from food and school fees.

Luisa would like to improve her earnings by means of purchasing a variety of stock of fruits and vegetables. These will enable her to have an adequate supply of stock to cater for the needs of her respective customers. In that way, her income will improve. She would also be able to settle her obligation and start to handle her finances wisely.

Luisa is hoping that she could make her business more sustainable to continue to finance the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack food, and personal care products.

Letecia has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, juice, shampoo, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Mary Gin

texts.en:
Mary Gin is 36 years old and married with three school-age children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Mary Gin has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Kirana

texts.en:
Kirana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of peanuts business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her business.

Kirana has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice and from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Kirana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additonal sacks of peanut to sell for her business

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Myra works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Myra is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Aida is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres es un joven campesino, dedicado a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, además posee diferentes cultivos que le han generado ingresos adicionales, para solventar los gastos básicos suyos y de su esposa.

Las labores del campo las aprendió de su padre, quien toda la vida se dedicó a trabajar la tierra y a criar animales. Hoy en día, a sus 24 años de edad, es reconocido por la calidad de los productos que ofrece en el mercado del municipio.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de más lechones y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar las ventas e ingresos que percibe por su labor.

Andres tiene como propósito darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de recursos, pues planea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita tomar la decisión para tener hijos en un futuro a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Andres is a young farmer, who makes a living by raising and selling pigs. He also has different crops that give him additional income to cover basic expenses for him and his wife. He learned how to work the land from his father, who made a living his whole life by working the land and raising animals. Today, at 24 years old, he is known for the quality of the products that he offers in the municipality's market.

The loan that he is requesting will be invested in buying more suckling pigs and feed for the animals. This will allow him to increase his production, and to improve his sales and the income he receives from his work. Andres's goal is to continue this resource-generating work, since he plans to improve his living conditions and achieve financial stability, which will allow him to make the decision to have children in the medium-term future.

loans.use: to buy more suckling pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Leidy Paola

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Leidy solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra insumos como carne, pollo, queso, jamón, pan salsa, entre otros para aumentar su materia prima.

Con tu ayuda Leidy Podrá pagar su educación!
texts.en:
Leidy is a very enterprising and tenacious woman with big dreams she has been cultivating and trying to make come true. She has a small business making and selling fast food. With this activity she tries to get ahead day to day and improve her family's living conditions.

Her biggest difficulty is the competition in the area but with her great capacity for work, she is able to support herself and progress.

Leidy is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as beef, chicken, cheese, ham, bread, sauce and more, in order to increase her raw materials.

With your help Leidy can pay for her education!

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as beef, chicken, cheese, ham, bread, sauce and more.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha, a government officer and also farmer, lives in Teab Srov Village with husband and 3 children. As a government officer, she needs bright light at night to do paper work. It is a challenge for her because her house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light. She can do paper work only at day time when the sun raises high enough to see thing clearly and stop her work before it is too dark.

As a result, she decided to apply for Kiva to buy a solar home system. She believes she will have enough energy for her family usage and also improve her working hours. She can work on her task both day and night time.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Teab Srov Village, Banteay Preal Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years. Melinda earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business

loans.name: Rubejin

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rubejin works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of gasoline business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. Rubejin is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Rubejin has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 44 years old and single with two children.

Angelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, snack foods, etc.

Angelita has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Angelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of sea cucumbers business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy sea cucumbers to sell,

Melita has been in this business for two years. Melita earns more income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Melita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sea cucumber to sell for her business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 44 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Leonora has a buy-and-sell oysters business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more oysters to sell in her stall.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more oysters to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis a sus 64 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos, por los que lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante. 

Nació en el seno de una familia campesina, en la que aprendió todas las labores del campo desde niño, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. 

Actualmente posee cultivos de fríjol y aguacate, además posee 2 vacas productoras de leche. El cliente es un hombre pujante, humilde y trabajador, a pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentan siempre está dispuesto a salir adelante. 

Solicita el crédito con el fin de ajustar el dinero para comprar una vaca productora de leche, con la cual podrá aumentar su producción y por ende sus ingresos por venta. 

De esta forma, Luis desea seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio lechero, que le permita tener mejores ingresos para su familia y así poder dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, who is 64 years old, is the father of 3 children, for whom he fights every day to help them get ahead. He was born in the bosom of a farming family, from whom he learned how to work the land since he was a kid, thanks to his father's teachings. Currently, he has bean and avocado crops. He also has 2 milk-producing cows.

This client is a thriving, humble, and hardworking man. Despite the obstacles that he faces, he is always willing to move forward. He is requesting the loan with the goal of using the money to buy a milk-producing cow, with which he will be able to increase his production and therefore his sales income. This way, Luis wants to continue fighting to achieve his goal of expanding his dairy business, which would allow him to have better income for his family and to give his children the opportunity to have better education and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a milk-producing cow, with which he will be able to increase his production.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es una bella mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices, también realizará algunas mejoras locativas.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Veronica is a beautiful 24 year old woman who is single and has no children. She was raised with very good values and since the time she was in high school she has developed a passion and liking for everything related to beauty.

She started her productive stage by taking courses and trainings, until one day she ventured out and decided to seek her own customers, opening a beauty salon in her home.

She is asking for a loan to buy inventory because she also wants to sell products to complement her services, such as hand cream, hair dye, and nail polish. She will also make some improvements on the locale.

For her, the loan will be very important because she will finish consolidating her business, finishing it with all of the materials necessary to operate and offer any service she is asked for.

Her dream is for her business to progress with Interactuar and to have a lot of customers.

loans.use: to buy hand cream, hair products, hair dyes, nail polish, and do some improvements on the locale.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Hace cuatro años, María se subió al tren de los emprendedores con la ayuda de su hijo, quien trabaja en un país vecino, para establecer una pulpería. Todo con el objetivo de salir adelante con la hija menor y así proveerle un mejor futuro. Ahora a sus 48 años de edad, esta madre de cuatro hijos, ya se siente contenta de ver creciendo a su pequeño negocio.
El sueño de María es ir mejorando el inventario de la pulpería, para ello, solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, jabón y otros productos para la pulpería. Con esto podrá tener siempre los productos que tanto anhelan sus clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos. En sus planes está obtener otro crédito más adelante, con el cual pueda ingresar en la venta de ropa también.
texts.en:
Four years ago, Maria got on the entrepreneurial train, with the help of her son who works in a neighboring country, to establish a grocery store. She did this with the goal of moving forward with her younger daughter and giving her a better future. Now, at 48 years old, she is the mother of four children, and she is happy to see her small business growing.

Maria's dream is to continue improving her store's inventory. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, soap, and other products for the store. With this, she will be able to always have the products that her clients want so badly, and this will increase her income. She plans to get another loan in the future, with which she can begin doing clothing sales as well.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, soap, and other products.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is married with two children. She owns a small business.

Maya sells bed linen, towels, bathrobes and tablecloths at the local market. She has been working in this business for 19 years. Maya rents her retail place. She is active and hardworking person.

Maya is asking for a loan of 60,000 to purchase goods for sale. The loan will help her to increase her assortment of goods and attract new clients.

loans.use: to purchase bed linen, towels, bathrobes and tableclothes

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
Orlando es caracterizado por sus amigos y familiares como una persona con muchos deseos de superación y con grandes metas de convertirse en uno de los profesionales más grandes del país. A sus 24 años de edad, es cirujano dentista y lleva más de dos años trabajando en el hospital estatal como pasante. Además, trabaja con su tía en una clínica que tiene con otros médicos, para seguir poniendo en práctica lo aprendido. Él cuanta con el apoyo de su padre, quien tiene un transporte de carga, y de su madre quien posee una pulpería. 
Desde niño, Orlando fue inspirado por su tía, pues llegaba siempre a su consultorio para apoyar en lo que necesitara, a pasar las pinzas, observar cómo cada instrumento era bien utilizado, convirtiéndose poco a poco la pasión y la carrera universitaria con la que se iba a graduar. Ahora, con la visión de seguir profesionalizándose, está estudiando una maestría, por lo que solicita un préstamo para cancelar el pago de esta maestría y así estar preparado para ofrecer un mejor servicio. En sus planes está optar por un trabajo en el instituto de salud nacional.
texts.en:
Orlando's friends and family describe him as a person who is very motivated to succeed and has the big goal to become one of the greatest professionals in his country. 24 years old, he is a dentist with more than two years experience working in the state hospital as an intern. He also works with his aunt in a clinic with other doctors in order to continue applying what he has learned. He has the support of his father, who transports freight, and his mother, who has a small grocery store.

Since he was a child, Orlando has been inspired by his aunt. He would always go to her office to help with whatever she needed, hand her the forceps, observe how to properly use each instrument, and gradually, dentistry became his passion and the university program he would complete.

Now, to continue his professional development, he is completing a Master's degree, and he is requesting a loan to cover the payment for the degree and thus be prepared to offer better service. He plans to pursue employment with the national health institute.

loans.use: pay for his Master's degree.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Agustina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods and dried fish. Agustina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Merie Joy

texts.en:
Merie Joy works hard to support her family. She is single and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Merie Joy has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Merie Joy has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Samoeun is 34 years old and a mother of four children, two of whom are schoolchildren. Growing rice and cassava are her primary sources of income for 16 years. She has been working for others for a fee to earn additional income. Due to weed has grown unexpectedly in her farm, her crop has grown not well so that she couldn’t get high yields as before.

She leads a group of two to request a new loan, which is the fifth cycle for her, with VisionFund. The previous loans helped her to improve her family's living condition. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed to support her rice and cassava farm. She hopes to earn more income so that she has enough ability to expand her current business and save more money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed to support her rice and cassava farming businesses

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Noemi is a 56 yrs of age married and has one child. Her husband is the only partner of her business. Naomi has been operating her business for more than 22 years and it is the source of their income.

Naomi took a new loan because she wants to buy as much cloth as possible to prepare for many orders in her tailoring shop and also to buy an additional machine. Naomi is improving their family living through this business, because she earns an income and she already accepts any kind of order in her tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es oriunda del departamento de Cochabamba de la provincia Arque, concubinada con el señor Segundino, la señora es una mujer muy humilde, trabajadora y responsable que se vinieron a trabajar desde muy joven a radicar al trópico de Cochabamba junto a su esposo en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo y una vida mejor. Trabajando duro y fuerte en la cosechas y mantenimiento de producciones de plátano, yuca, citricos, se compraron un lote agrícola en el sindicato Villa Fatima en donde actualmente trabajan con la producción de plátano y yuca, para lo cual requieren el préstamo por que tienen planeado hacer un mantenimiento general a sus plantaciones de plátano, donde también se compraron un lote urbano en la urbanización de Nueva Unión, en donde construyeron su casa de madera de dos cuartos, en donde viven toda su familia de donde les queda cerca para que vayan sus hijos para asistir a sus clases, la cliente actualmente se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado central de chimore y su conyugue trabajo en si lote agrícola donde tiene la producción de plátano y yuca en el sindicato villa fatima.
texts.en: Maria is from the department of Cochabamba in the province Arque. She is in a common law marriage with Segundino. She is a very humble, hardworking and responsible woman. They both came when they were very young  to the tropics of Cochabamba seeking new opportunities for work and a better life. Working hard and strong on their crops and growing plantains, yucca, and citrus, they bough a lot of farmland in Villa Fatima, where they now work growing plantains and yucca. That is what they need the loan for because they are going to do general maintenance on their plantain crops. They also bought a lot in the Nueva Unión development, where they built a wooden house with two rooms. There who family lives there and it is close to where their children can go to school. The client now sells vegetables in the central market in Chimore and her spouse works on the farmland growing plantains and yucca in Villa Fatima.

loans.use: to improve the soil for her crops and to grow plantains and yucca, thus generating better income for her family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and has six children. Victoria is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old, widowed and has six children.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Virginia has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Fremilyn

texts.en:
Fremilyn is 34 years old and has eight children.  Fremilyn is married and has six children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Fremilyn requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Fremilyn has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fremilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs
