Due to a lack of finances, Bory would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees from the first to the fifth year. This loan will help him graduate and achieve his dreams.

In the future, he is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary, and save money to build his own house. If he has children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees, if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees from the first to the fifth year.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 45-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is responsible for taking care of three children; two of them attend school. He runs a retail shop that sells soft drinks, soap, sugar, and salt. He has been in business since 2010 to earn income to support the family. To supplement his income, Henry also deals in buying and selling produce. His dream is to educate his children and develop his business. Inadequate capital plus inflation pose great challenges to his business. He intends to use the loan to buy soft drinks, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Gaith

texts.en:
Gaith is a 32-year-old married father of one child. Almost a year ago, he got employed in the sales department to better cover the needs and expenses of his family. He is an ambitious man who is still continuing his university studies. That's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university tuition fees for his Masters degree in Business Administration.

Gaith believes that education gives a knowledge of the world and changes it into something better, as it helps in building opinions and have points of view on things in life. Gaith believes that education serves as the gateway to better options and more opportunity.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees for his masters Masters degree in Business Administration

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 20-year-old single lady who started two years ago working as an accountant to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hardworking, ambitious, and independent lady who is still continuing her studies beside her job.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her university tuition fees in Accounting. Walaa believes that education is the only way to guarantee her future and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees for a degree in Accounting

loans.name: Nokutenda Group

texts.en:
Stella lives in a low density suburb in Harare. She is 46 years old, and is a mother of 4 though for the moment she only lives with her grandchildren. Her husband went to South Africa in 2008 to look for greener pastures so together they work towards the betterment of their family. She has held the treasurers’ role in the Nokutenda group since August 2012 when the group was formed.

The group is now one member short because she relocated to her new residential stand. The group comprises of four hardworking and committed women in business. Stella may not be qualified but is a zealous tailor and she has a serious poultry business. When she approached Thrive, she had only 50 birds and 1 domestic machine. Thrive gave her a first loan of $500 and she utilised it well to develop her businesses. In the group’s fourth loan cycle, Stella improved by having 3-week cycles of 200 birds and also extended her fowl run to a 1000 bird carrying capacity. She also bought 2 heavy duty sewing machines and employed two people, one to help with taking care of the chickens and the other to help with dress making.

From the profits from her business, she has managed to do some household improvements and finish building a cottage at her home. As a group, they are applying for $6100 and Stella wants to use her loan to finance her poultry project so that she fully utilises her fowl run and also plans to take up indigenous chickens as well since she has found a market in canteens and restaurants where customers are requesting them.

loans.use: to finance her poultry project so that she fully utilises her fowl run and also plans to take up indigenous chickens as well.

loans.name: Efren De Jesus

texts.es:
Siempre con una sonrisa dibujada en su rostro, con el optimismo de que cada día trae algo bueno sale el señor Efrén a trabajar en su negocio de venta de alimentos, actividad que inicio hace algunos años por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, encontrando en la venta ambulante de guarapo, una felicidad que no logró cuando era empleado.
Vive en unión libre con su pareja, no tiene hijos, sus objetivos siempre se centran en mejorar las condiciones y aspecto de su vivienda, tener un alimento en la mesa, sostenibilidad en el tiempo y lo más importante, salud para levantarse cada día a dar lo mejor de sí, produciendo y vendiendo productos.
El señor Efrén quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una máquina procesadora de caña para optimizar sus procesos y producir mayor cantidad de guarapos, mejorando los estándares de calidad y de higiene.
texts.en:
Always with a smile on his face, with the optimism that every day brings something good, Efrén goes out to work in his business selling food, work that he began some years ago by preference and vocation to work independently finding, in the sale of guarapo [a sugar cane drink] as a street vendor, a happiness that he wasn't able to achieve when he was an employee.

He lives in a common-law marriage with his partner, doesn't have children, and his goals are always focused on improving the condition and appearance of his house, having food on the table, sustainability over time, and - most importantly - health to get up every day to give his best, producing and selling products.

Efrén wants to ask for a loan to purchase a sugar cane processing machine to optimize his processes and produce a larger quantity of guarapo, improving his quality and hygiene standards.

loans.use: to purchase a sugar cane processing machine to optimize his processes.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela, mujer mil batallas, una persona que sabe valerse de sí misma, que tiene muy claro el significado de pelear por sus ideales y sueños, ella es soltera, con mucho empeño y largas jornadas laborales logro constituir una cafetería y ahora se esfuerza diariamente para hacer que su negocio prospere y se mantenga en el tiempo.
Ella no tiene en quien apoyarse, por eso para lograr crecer se basa mucho en sus ahorros y apoyos económicos.
Maricela está actualmente solicitando un préstamo para comprar algunos enseres que le hacen falta en su cafetería y surtido de productos fritos, congelados, refrescos, snacks, dulces, entre otros para abastecer su cafetería.
Apoya a esta cliente que siempre ha hecho las cosas por su cuenta, hazla sentir que tiene el apoyo de muchas personas que se preocupan y quieren que triunfe como empresaria.
texts.en:
Maricela is a veteran of a thousand battles. She is a person who knows how to fend for herself. She understands the meaning of fighting for her ideals and dreams very clearly. She is single and by working long hours very hard and was able to open a cafe. Now she strives every day to make her business prosper and up to date.

She has no one to depend on, and that is why in order to grow she has used her savings and financial help.

Maricela is now asking for a loan to buy some fixtures she needs for her cafe as well as an inventory of fried foods, frozen foods, beverages, snacks, candies and more, to stock her cafe.

Support this client who has always done everything on her own. Make her feel that she has the support of many people who care about her and want her to triumph as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of fried foods, frozen foods, beverages, candies and more to stock her cafe.

loans.name: Yasira

texts.en:
Three years ago, Yasira opened a school which now has 129 students, half of which are girls. Yasira was lucky enough to be educated when she was younger and wanted to use her skills to educate more children in her area, with support from her husband and family. A major challenge she is still trying to overcome is the capacity of the building as she is unable to cope with the influx of students.

In order accommodate more students Yasira borrowed PKR 180,000, to construct few more rooms and to buy basic school supplies such as furniture. She hopes this is going to help the school move forward and be as productive as it can and make a real difference in her community.

loans.use: to construct a few more rooms and to buy basic school supplies such as furniture for her school

loans.name: St. Agnes Girls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Abert. He is the Director of St. Agnes Girls Secondary School, a girls school in the Rural are of Bushenyi with 500 students. St. Agnes Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Agnes Girls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Abert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. She has operated a fish-selling business for the past ten years. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Her income is mainly from her business and fishing so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en: Prosper is a 54-year-old widowed female living in Masindi, Uganda. She has a piggery project where she earns a living. She built houses for rent to add to her income. She started the business in 2009 to be able to support the family after the death of her husband. She is a hardworking lady who promised to take very good care of her family and dreams of educating her children to the university level. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet sells food stuffs like bananas, for 10 years. She is very experienced in this business.  She desires to do better in this business, but is limited by capital. She has a responsibility of paying school fees for her children. She is now constructing a house, though she lacks materials specifically like bricks, nails, and cement. She requests for money to buy construction materials like bricks, nails, and cement for using to construct her dream house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, nails, and cement for using to construct her dream house.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer honesta y trabajadora, de cincuenta y ocho años de edad, desde hace doce años empezó su negocio de pulpería, el cual gracias a su buena administración se vuelve cada ves más rentable. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con MiCrédito, para ser exactos se le han otorgado ocho financiamientos y uno con Kiva, el cual le dejo tan buenos resultados que hacen esta mujer se encuentre profundamente agradecida con ambas organizaciones.
Ella confía profundamente en Kiva junto a MiCrédito, por eso ha vuelto a solicitar un crédito, que planea usar para la compra de comida y refrescos enlatadas, frituras, embutidos, productos lácteos, entre muchos otros, que tienen gran demanda en su próspero negocio. Sus planes a futuro es comprar un vehículo para movilizarse mejor hacia los centros donde se abastece.
texts.en:
Angela is an honest and hard-working 58 year-old woman, 12 years ago she started her grocery store business, which thanks to her good management is becoming more and more profitable. 

She has spent a long time working with MyCredit, to be exact she has received 8 loans and 1 with Kiva, she achieved great results from this which is why she is profoundly grateful to both organisations. 


She trusts in Kiva and MyCredit which is why she has returned to ask for a loan, which she plans on using to buy food and cans of drink, fried goods, and dairy goods amongst other things, which are in great demand in her business. 

Her future plans are to buy a vehicle to travel more easily between the places she supplies.

loans.use: to buy food and cans of drinks, fried goods, cold cuts, and dairy goods amongst others.

loans.name: Leidy Johanna

texts.es:
Leidy necesita de tu apoyo, de tu ayuda, un impulso para iniciar un negocio, que será el medio de sostenimiento para esta mujer de 30 años de edad y para su familia.
Cansada de deambular de un lado para otro, tomando empleos inestables, de estar en su casa preocupada por el dinero para la comida, Leidy acude a la corporación con el ánimo de iniciar un negocio de alquiler de videojuegos que ubicara en una sala de su hogar.
El monto será para la compra de televisores, consolas de videojuegos, conexiones, sillas, mesas, adecuaciones locativas y ventiladores.
texts.en:
Leidy needs your support, your help, a boost to begin a business, which will be the means of sustaining this 30-year-old woman and her family.

Tired of going from one place to another, taking unstable jobs, of being in her house worried about the money for food, Leidy came to the corporation with the desire to begin a business renting video games which she will locate in a room in her home.

The amount will be to purchase televisions, video game consoles, connectors, chairs, tables, modifications to her space, and fans.

loans.use: to purchase televisions, video game consoles, connectors, chairs, tables, modifications to her space, and fans.

loans.name: Sorany Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Sorany una hermosa joven de 18 años de edad, una joven soñadora, una joven que quiere fabricar sus propias oportunidades, que quiere estudiar, que quiere ser alguien en la vida, para ello quiere iniciar un negocio como independiente de venta de mercancía, buscando un único objetivo que será adquirir el dinero suficiente para pagar una matrícula universitaria y apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar y en un futuro lejano lograr la independencia y adquirir bienes como vivienda, carro etc., pero inicialmente comenzar a estudiar lo más pronto posible.
Sorany quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar la búsqueda de sus sueños, dicho monto lo invertirá en la compra de camisetas para dama y hombre, ropa interior, accesorios y gorras.
texts.en:
This is Sorany, a lovely young woman, 18 years old, a visionary young woman, a young woman who wants to make her own opportunities, who wants to go to school, who wants to be someone in life. So, she wants to begin a business as an independent sales person of merchandise, seeking her only objective which would be to get enough money to pay the university fees and support her family in the household expenses and, in the long term, achieve independence and get goods such as a house, car, etc., but first to begin studying as soon as possible.

Sorany wants to ask for a loan to begin the search for her dreams, this amount will be invested in the purchase of shirts for women and men, lingerie, accessories and hats.

loans.use: to purchase women's and men's shirts, lingerie, accessories and hats.

loans.name: Iveri

texts.en:
Iveri is 21 years old. He lives in Gori district with his brother and parents. He is unemployed and has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but he hasn't had any success. He wants to start his own bakery, but his loan requests have always been rejected in the past because of his lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers.

Iveri has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, Iveri will start his own bakery. He will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it for a good price. Iveri hopes his project will be profitable as he already has the baking experience and will offer quality products to his customers. This will increase his sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to open a bakery and bake Georgian national bread

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, no siguió estudiando porque se trasladaron a otro municipio y la escuela le quedaba lejos; después se acompañó, tuvo una niña y se separó de su pareja.

Gloria, trabaja en la agricultura y este trabajo lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de llevar el alimento diario a su casa, pues sus padres no podían apoyarla económicamente, ella trabaja a dos cuadras de su casa y mientras trabaja en la agricultura su vecina le ayuda a cuidar su hija, pues trabaja cuatro horas diarias.

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro sacos de abono químico para fertilizar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El sueño más grande de Gloria, es construir una pequeña casa donde pueda vivir con su hija.
texts.en:
Gloria is 26 years old. She went to school up to the sixth grade. She didn't continue going to school because they moved to another town and the school was far away. Later, she married, had a daughter, and separated from her spouse.

Gloria works in agriculture and she learned this work out a need to support her home. Her parents couldn't help her financially. She works two blocks from her house and while she works in agriculture, her neighbor cares for her daughter. She works four hours a day.

Gloria needs the loan to buy four sacks of chemical fertilizer to fertilize 14,000 square meters of corn.

Gloria's biggest dream is to build a small house where she can live with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of chemical fertilizer to fertilize 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Gouri Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in the year 2015 at Dengapadar village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 10 active self-dependent women, with the goal of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods.

Babita is one of them. She has taken a great role in her development and her revenue improvement. She is standing third from left with raised hand in the photo. She is about 29 years old and living with her husband and only son.

Babita and her husband have been engaged in a tea and tiffin (a light meal) stall business for four years. Through this business they earn a monthly income of 6,500 INR. Babita plans to improve her business in the course of the loan. She will purchase necessary utensils, four chairs, a gas stove and rice, wheat, oil, etc. She hopes to get more income through the expansion of her business and from that, she will save more for her future needs.

The other nine members of her group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different businesses such as vegetable vending, tailoring, dairy, etc. With this loan they all hope to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase necessary utensils, four chairs, a gas stove and tea, sugar, rice, wheat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy is a hardworking woman, who is 25 years old. She is married and has two children.

This loan can help Thuy to build a latrine that will improve her family's living standards. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing. With support from her husband, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Yesu Nti Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a retailer who dedicates much effort to boost her business, She is the president of the borrower group “yesu nti” (“for Christ sake”)in the localities of Chorkor. She is a single parent and a mother of two children, both in school.

She has owned a kiosk in one of the city’s streets for nine years at her residence, where she sells everyday items.

She wishes to increase her capital,pay her children school fees, and feed them. In conclusion, she wants to thank Kiva through ID-Ghana for its support to entrepreneurs from traditional banking systems.

loans.use: to increase her capital, pay her children school fees and feed them. .

loans.name: Doednath

texts.en:
Doednath is 53 years old and lives together with his wife and 2 children. He works as a field worker at a banana company and in his free time he cultivates 7 hectares of rice for an extra income.

Doednath wants now to expand his areas and is short on finances. For this, he needs a loan of SRD 6.000 to purchase the inputs for his rice production such as pesticides, fertilizer and diesel. Doednath's dream is to give his children good education to secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase the inputs for his rice production.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo owns 25 cows and used to spend more than one hour per day moving their waste to a corner of his farm, where it was generating bad smells and attracting flies. In parallel, he was spending an important portion of his revenues on fossil fuel based LP gas and chemical fertilizers.

He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to save money by transforming a problem into a productive solution: from now on, he will use his animals' manure to produce biogas and organic fertilizer. He will improve his farm's cost-effectiveness by treating the waste and turning it into productive resources. The yield of his corn and forage fields will improve in a natural way with the nutrient-rich fertilizer, while he will cook and heat water with renewable energy. Cirilo plans to use his savings to grow his farm, produce more milk and save to send his children to university.

This loan represents 35% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Ponhea Krek district of Tbaung Khmum province, Kun is 23 years old and a mother of a small child who is under age of school. Her main business is growing cassava and she can earn more income via growing rice to support her family’s living.

Due to lacking of working capital, she is now applying for a loan which is the first time of her with VisionFund in order to help her business. In a group of four, Kun is the group leader. She is willing use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase the crop productivity. She hopes that the crop will growing well and provide her more outputs than before so that she can earn more income to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase the crop productivity as well as the income so as to upgrade her living standard.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tiana

texts.fr:
Tiana a 25 ans. Son mari travaille comme maçon. Les revenus tirés de l’activité permettent de compléter les revenus du ménage car  l’activité du mari est saisonnière. Elle vend différents accessoires depuis 2009. Avant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche. Le développement de cette activité dépend de la qualité et de la diversification des articles. En effet, les articles doivent répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle a toujours cherché les moyens pour développer l’activité par la demande de prêt afin d’augmenter le stock de produits et les diversifier. 
Le Couple a un enfant de 5 ans scolarisé. Le ménage ne paie pas de loyer car il habite dans un local appartenant à ses parents. Le couple prévoit  d’acquérir un terrain afin d’y construire une maison. L’augmentation de l’épargne permettra de réaliser ce projet.
texts.en:
Tiana is 25 years old. Her husband works as a mason. The earnings from her work supplement their household's income, because her husband's work is seasonal.

Tiana has worked selling various accessories since 2009. Before, she was working in a free-trade zone company.

The development of her business depends on the quality and diversification of her products. These products also need to respond to customer demand.

Tiana has always searched for the means to develop her business, and she is seeking this loan to increase and diversify her stock.

Tiana and her husband have one five-year-old child who goes to school. The couple does not have to pay rent, because they live in a place owned by their parents. They want to acquire a piece of land so that they can build their own house. By increasing their savings, they will be able to realize this goal.

loans.use: to buy different products, such as phone covers, binders, and wallets.

loans.name: Sreyudom

texts.en:
Sreyudom is 19 years old, a single freshman who is from Takeo Province of Cambodia. He is pursuing a degree, majoring in Electrical Engineering at a university in the city. His father is a teacher and her mother is a vegetable seller.

Due to the fact that he is short of the finances needed to pay his tuition fees from first to second year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully. After earning his associate’s degree, Sreyudom is going to find a good job with a decent salary.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from first to second year, for a degree in Electrical Engineering.

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Frontera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES SIN FRONTERA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paula es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, salón de belleza, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de calzados, venta de jugos, venta de deportivos, venta de frutas, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paula es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace ocho años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en el departamento de Potosí. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella esta soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MUJERES SIN FRONTERA” communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the German Busch focal center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, including Paula, who is the president. The businesses the members of the communal bank has are varied. Among them are selling blankets, a beauty salon, transportation service, selling food, selling shoes, selling juices, selling sports shoes, selling fruit and selling skirts.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Paula. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She has a business selling blankets. She says that she learned this business from her parents and decided to open her own business eight years ago.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying wool wholesale. She will acquire it from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and after making the blankets, she will sell them in the department of Potosí. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health and the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
El Señor Fidencio es de la Ciudad de Santaní, está casado, y su señora se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, ambos se ayudan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Él es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, se dedica a las ventas ambulantes y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Comenta que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela que siempre compra de él, ya que da muchas accesibilidades a sus clientes. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos variados para seguir haciendo sus ventas, como ser prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Fidencio is from the city of Santaní, he is married and his wife earns a living selling fast food. They both help each other to be able to improve their living conditions. He is a very hard-working, responsible and honest man, and earns a living travelling around selling wholesale goods to be able to support his family.  

He says that he already has very good clients that always buy from him, given that he is very accessible for his clients. He is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying various products to be able to continue with his sales, such as clothing, footwear, and bazaar products. He is grateful for the opportunity he is being given to carry on working.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell, such as: clothing, footwear, bazaar products and other things

loans.name: Al Akbar Group

texts.en:
Horriya is the featured borrower of Al Akbar group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends and they seek to improve and develop their living.

Horriya is the lady sitting at the far left side of the picture wearing white, she is a 36 years old single lady the major earner of her family which consists of four other members.

Horriya wants her beloved mother to rest, so she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy an automatic washing machine to provide her with a less tiring home cleaning requests.
She works in a shoe selling shop for nine years with a limited monthly salary, but still she hopes to stay capable of supporting her family in any requested way. Fatima is the lady in black at the center of the picture, while Sawsan is the lady at the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: to buy an automatic washing machine to provide her mother with a less tiring home cleaning request.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una hermosa joven de 23 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de mercancía, principalmente ropa y acolchados para el hogar,  una madre madura que tiene una hermosa bebe de tan solo 8 meses de edad, vive en un hogar conformado por su hija y su esposo.
Ella siempre ha demostrado gran gusto por el trabajo independiente y no es capaz de quedarse en casa solo limpiando y preparando la cena, tiene que trabajar y ella sabe que los ingresos que aporta en su casa son muy importantes y más que se trazó la meta con su esposo de comprar una vivienda propia y pagar la educación de su hermosa hija.
En víspera de la temporada navideña la joven quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de mercancía como ropa y lencería para hogar, teniendo un amplio y variado surtido para sus posibles compradores.
texts.en:
Ana María is a lovely 23-year-old woman, who works selling merchandise, primarily clothing and quilts for the home. She is a mature mother who has a lovely baby, just 8 months old, and lives in a household made up of her daughter and her husband.

She has always shown a great enjoyment of independent work, and she is not capable of staying at home just cleaning and making dinner, she has to work and she knows that the income that she contributes in her house is very important and more, that she established the goal with her husband to purchase their own house and pay for their lovely daughter's education.

On the eve of the Christmas season, the young woman wants to ask for a loan to stock up merchandise such as clothing and linens for the home, having a wide and varied assortment for her potential customers.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise such as clothing and linens for the home.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es: Catalino, de 40 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, está casado, y reside en una aldea del municipio de la campa, Lempira, en compañía de sus 4 hijos menores y su esposa. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos y como otra actividad a la albañilería, pero actualmente su mayor fuente de ingresos es la producción de café. Esta actividad la realiza en una zona agrícola de la localidad vecina, donde ofrece café en oro a sus clientes.  Él solicita la cantidad de 30,000 Lempiras que utilizara en la finca para comprar abonos y fertilizar la tierra para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos a fin de tener una mejor producción. Su meta es hacerle mejoras a su casa, para seguir cuidando del bienestar de su familia y seguir con el cultivo.
texts.en: Catalino, 40 years old, has 6 children, is married, and lives in a village in the municipality of La Campa, Lempira, in the company of his 4 younger children and his wife. He has always worked in growing basic grains and, as additional work, in construction, but currently his greatest source of income is coffee production. He does this work in an agricultural zone in the neighboring area, where he sells the coffee beans to his customers. He asks for the quantity of 30,000 lempiras which he will use in the farm to purchase manure and fertilize the land to care for his crops with the end of having a better production. His goal is to make improvements to his house, to continue caring for his family's well-being and continue with the cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase manure to fertilize the land and care for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, actualmente está soltera y es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y 2 le ayudan en el hogar.


Eva se dedica a los oficios domésticos, actividad que realiza desde los 15 años, también realiza venta de tamales  y nuégados, esta actividad la hace 3 veces a la semana y la venta la realiza en el cantón, sus hijos le ayudan siempre que pueden pues ella los ha educado para que sean personas agradecidas y trabajadoras.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar 54 cerdos de engorde, también comprará 4 quintales de concentrado para cerdos.


El sueño de Eva es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios, mejorar su vivienda y cambiar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Eva is 34 years old and studied until 6th grade, currently she is single and has 4 children, 2 of which study and 2 help around the house. 

Eva earns a living cleaning, something that she had done since 15 years of age. She also sells tamales and nougat, this is something she does 3 times a week selling them at a market. She always helps her children so that they have been educated to become grateful and hard-working people. 

The loan will be used to buy 54 fattening pigs and also 400lbs of pig feed. 

Eva's dream is to carry on working to help her children move forward with their studies, and to improve their home and change their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 54 fattening pigs, she will also buy 400lbs of pig feed.

loans.name: Tuni

texts.en:
Tuni is a resident of Gunpur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 28 years old. She has a small family with her husband and one son. Her husband is working in an NGO.

Tuni is running a tea stall of her own. She has the basic necessities of life, like a small but permanent income, a two-wheeler and other allied items to manage her family. Still her family members are not happy because they lack a pakka house.

At present they are staying at a rented house with high rate of rent charged by house owner. The rented house is made of mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during rainy season. It is also very difficult during winter. The most important thing is that the house is not secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct an RCC (reinforced concrete) house. She has already started to construct the house, but lacks the funds to complete it. So she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At that moment, Tuni came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. From the loan, Tuni will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and painting of the house. She will also complete the wiring with electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months and she will be proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, metal, paint and electric materials.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Ella es luz Elena, mujer casada de 35 años de edad, madre de dos hijas de 14 y 9 años de edad, que se dedica a la actividad de confección de línea propia, siempre le ha gustado la moda, es su hobby y quiso hacer de esa pasión el medio para generar ingresos para comprar sus caprichos y apoyar en el sostenimiento de su hogar y más importante impulsar y motivar los gustos y sueños de sus dos hermosas princesas.
Su objetivo principal es mejorar sus ventas, hacer que sus prendas la lleven cada día más personas y la temporada de diciembre será el evento perfecto para darle un importante impulso a sus ventas, es por ello que quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de telas e insumos de confección, con los cuales producirá mayor volumen y variedad de  prendas.
texts.en:
This is Elena, a married woman, 35 years old, the mother of two daughters, ages 14 and 9, who works sewing her own line of clothing. She has always liked fashion, it is her hobby and she wanted to make this passion the means to generate income to pay for her whims and to support the maintenance of her household and, more importantly, to boost and motivate the preferences and dreams of her two lovely princesses.

Her primary objective is to improve her sales, make more people buy her clothing each day and the December season will be the perfect event to give a significant boost to her sales. For this, she wants to ask for a loan to purchase fabric and sewing supplies, with which she will produce a larger volume and variety of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong is a hardworking woman, who is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and five children in a small house that is without a hygienic latrine. Huong's family’s income is mainly from fishing.

Huong would like to take a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is maize farmer from Ranau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ado is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ado can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ado is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 45-year old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She has 6 children. Her son has run a general store for 1 year and wants to purchase rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other items for his business . Allah Rakhi's husband is not in a position to buy these products to resell.

Allah Rakhi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy merchandise and help him to earn a profitable income to manage his house hold and business.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her son's general store .

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa is 37 years old, and she is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children.

This loan can help Hoa to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as protect the environment.

Fishing is the main source of income for her family. Therefore, Hoa will be able to repay the loan monthly from profits made selling fish which her husband catches.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is a 19-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He left school at early to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family that consists of four members. Two years ago, he got employed with limited salary in a wheel maintenance shop.
Mansour is a hard worker, responsible and ambitious man, who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to help his father in developing his cafe shop through buying the necessary coffee materials.
Mansour hopes to stay capable of helping his father in expanding his cafe to increase their family's income.

loans.use: to help his father in developing his cafe shop through buying the necessary coffee materials.

loans.name: Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YUNGUYO” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sara es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de mantas, venta de víveres, venta de comida, venta de calzas para damas, venta de verduras, venta de ropa para bebé, carpintería. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sara es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de frazadas para bebé; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace cuatro años, inicio realizando los tejidos de las frazadas a mano, en la actualidad, la señora cuenta con una maquina tejedora que le ayuda a tener una mayor productividad, quien le ayuda en su negocio es su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo implementara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución y el apoyo de las integrantes de su Banca Comunal.

En la foto no aparece la señora Dalia ya que, después del desembolso, tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The “YUNGUYO” communal bank will begin its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Sara is the secretary. The businesses that the members carry out are varied and among them are: sweater sales, blanket sales, grocery sales, food sales, women's pants sales, vegetable sales, baby clothing sales, and carpentry.

The loan that they are getting will benefit the small business owners of whom Sara is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer nine years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business knitting and selling baby blankets. She say that she began this business four years ago, she began making the blankets by hand, and currently she has a knitting machine that helps her to have better productivity. Her husband helps her in her business.

The loan that she is now getting will be to increase her capital (purchase wool in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later, after production, will sell it in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training that the institution offers and the support of the members of the communal bank.

Dalia is not in the photo because, after the payment, she had to go to her sales space.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 20 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. Her father represents the main income source in the family in order to fulfill their daily needs and represents the main income source.

Zeinab doesn't work, as she is only focusing on her studies. With the aim to pay her Technical study fees, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her Technical study fees

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store to sell noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo, and assorted canned goods. She is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. Three of her children attend school.

Her sari-sari (variety} store is located near her home and serves neighbors and nearby residents.
She also sells fresh fish to the local people.

She would like to improve her income to become more productive and improve the family’s living conditions. She will use the loan to buy stock for the store and a fishing net. These will help increase her business. She wants to settle her obligations and handle her finances wisely.

In the future, Ma. Evelyn is looking forward to providing her family with good food and better shelter.

loans.use: to buy  stock and a  fishing net.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a sea shell business and is borrowing 1,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sea shells to sell.

Josefina has sustained her business through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea shells to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a resident of Gunpur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 33 years old. She is living with her husband and two sons. Her husband is running a motor garage of his own.

Mamata has the basic necessities of life, such as a permanent monthly income from an established business, a two-wheeler and allied items to manage her family. Still her family members are not happy because they lack a good RCC house.

They are staying at a rented house with high rate of rent and insufficient facilities. It is very difficult to leave during rainy season. It is also very hard during summer and winter seasons.

In this situation, she decided to construct a house. She has already started to construct the house. But she lacks sufficient funds to complete it. So Mamata decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At that moment she came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan to Mamata for house construction. From the loan Mamata will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and painting of the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months. This will not only reduce the financial burden but also help Mamata to feel proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, metal, paint and electric materials.

loans.name: Mukurumbira Group

texts.en:
Chipo is a 40-year-old woman who resides in a high-density suburb in Harare. She is a widow and is a mother of five children with one still in school. Chipo owns a roadside stall selling fruits and vegetables and other groceries like milk, bread and eggs.

Before the break of dawn, she travels to Mbare market to buy the fruits and vegetables from farmers who sell their produce at the market. After buying her fruits and vegetables, she goes back home, prepares her roadside stall and business commences. She spends the whole day from around 8am up until around 7pm serving her customers and even after she has closed her stall those who know where she stays are free to buy after working hours and she has earned herself customer loyalty.

While doing all these things in the morning, day and in the evenings she has to play a motherly role for her children. Chipo, Janie, and Jane are part of the Mukurumbira group and have been able to access loans from Thrive Microfinance since mid-2014. They have approached Thrive for a third loan of $1500 and Chipo needs financial assistance for her business, as she wants to extend her stall and stock more than just breakfast items.

loans.use: to extend her stall and stock more than just breakfast items.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a single woman with two school-aged children. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Cynthia has operated a stall to sell vegetables for three years. She is challenged by changing seasons.

She wants to purchase onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase onions.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. She works very hard to provide for them .

Fishing is the main income of her family. SHe will this this loan to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's standard of living and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 52-year-old married woman with three children who runs a store. She wants to improve sales and pay for her children’s education.

She will use 10,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, milk, canned good, noodles, and detergent to sell. THis loan will keep her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy  soft drinks, milk, canned good, noodles, and detergent.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es una mujer de cincuenta y seis años de edad, que sabe que su verdadera vocación es ser comerciante, ella tiene treinta y cuatro años de vender comida, refrescos y golosinas a las afueras de un colegio de escuela primaria y secundaria, es además una clienta con mucha trayectoria de trabajo con MiCredito y ha experimentado con créditos de Kiva, por lo cual ella ha hecho de ambas organizaciones sus grandes aliados en su camino como comerciante. 
Ella ha vuelto a recurrir a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito porque necesita abastecerse de muchos productos y comprar golosinas, galletas, refrescos enlatados, frituras, etc, dado que con las ventas de esta temporada logra amortiguar el tiempo que la escuela está de vacaciones. En un futuro desea poder comprar un carrito con cocina integrada para comenzar a vender productos como hamburguesas y hotdogs.
texts.en:
Mariana is a fifty-six-year-old woman who knows that her true vocation is to be a saleswoman. She has been selling food, soft drinks, and candies for thirty-four years outside a primary and secondary school. In addition, she is a client with a long history of working with MiCrédito and has experienced Kiva loans, so she has made both organizations her great allies on her path as a saleswoman.

She has come back for a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito because she needs to stock up on many products and purchase candies, cookies, canned soft drinks, fried foods, etc. since with the sales of this season, she will manage to buffer the time that the school is on vacation. In the future, she wants to purchase a cart with built-in stove to begin to sell products such as hamburgers and hot dogs.

loans.use: to purchase candies, cookies, canned soft drinks, fried foods, etc.

loans.name: Jami

texts.en:
Jami is a resident of Gunpur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 35 years old. She is living with her small family, her husband and two children. She and her husband are engaged in tailoring work.

She has the basic necessities of life, with a small but permanent income, a two-wheeler and a good shop and other items to manage her family. Still her family members are not so happy because they lack a good RCC (reinforced concrete) house.

At present Jami and her family are staying at a rented house with high rate of rent. The rented house is made from mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during rainy season. The most important thing is the house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a small house with all possible facilites. She has already started to construct the house. But she lacks sufficient funds to complete it. So she decided to borrow loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At that moment, Jami came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. From the loan Jami will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and painting of the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden but also helps Jami to feel proud to have an owned house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, metal, bricks, paint and electric materials.

loans.name: Yahowa A Dzo Wo Group

texts.en:
Cynthia is an incredible distributor of rice with 11 years experience and in her third cycle of loans. She seeks a loan of 4200ghs with her counterparts in "Yahowa A Dzo Wo group" (chorkor in the Greater Accra of Ghana) to boost capital in order to fulfill their customers demands.

Cynthia is married to Emmanuel who is a driver, mother of three and a supportive wife. She lives with her family at their own residence.

She deals in the purchasing and supply of rice in the local market on a wholesale base. Her customers are in need of more cereals, therefore she seeks the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana for the fulfillment of her purpose.
She also promise to repay, considering her loyalty in payment as planned.

loans.use: to boost capital in order to fulfill her customers demands for rice.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is a 46- year-old, married woman with one child. She lives in rural area and has raised poultry and cattle for 20 years.

The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 34-year-old responsible woman with four children who happily lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her first loan with the BRAC and Kiva.

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and waste papers. He purchased scrap goods and sells it to the recycling factories. He does not have money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to earn money.

Shabana requests a loan for her husband to buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and save money to meet sudden needs.

She is very impressed with this support and wishes to take additional loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and waste papers  for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is resident of Gunpur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 38 years old. She has a small family: her husband and two sons. Her husband is working as a mason. Saraswati is running a tea and tiffin stall of her own.

She has all the basic necessities of life like a small but permanent income and other allied items to manage her family. Still her family members are not so happy because they lack a pacca (brick or stone) house.

At present, they are staying at rented house with a high rate of rent charged by the house owner. The rented house is made of mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates very critical situation during rainy season. It is also difficult during winter. The most important thing is the house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, Saraswati decided to construct an RCC (reinforced concrete) house. She has already started to construct the house. But she lacks the funds to complete it. So she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At that moment Saraswati came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. From the loan Saraswati will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and painting of the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months and she will be proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, metal, sand, electric equipment, paint and bricks.

loans.name: Hamied

texts.en: Hamied is 40 years old, has a family with one child that is still going school. Preveously, he was working for other rice farmers in their fields. In 2014 he started with the support of Seva MFI with his own rice cultivation. He plant rice on a plot of land which he inherited from his parents. With his savings he bought a 2nd hand tractor. Hamied wants to send his child for higher education and for this he needs to save enough. He approached Seva MFI for a new loan of SRD 5.000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and improve his rice production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Elda works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passenger. Elda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Elda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 53-year-old married woman with ten children, one attends school. Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia has had a general store for 4 years and requests 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She sells canned good, snack foods, school supplies, and other groceries.

In the future Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is resident of Gunpur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 51 years old. She is living with her husband and two sons. Her husband is running a bangle shop of his own. Laxmi is doing tailoring work to add some extra income for the household.

She has the basic necessities of life: permanent monthly incomes from established businesses, a two-wheeler and allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not so happy because they lack a good RCC (reinforced concrete) house.

They are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent and without sufficient facilities. It is very difficult to leave during rainy season. It is also very difficult to stay during summer and winter seasons.

In this situation, she decided to construct a house. She has already started to construct the house. But she lacks sufficient funds to complete it. So Laxmi decided to borrow loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At that moment she came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan to Laxmi for house construction. From the loan Laxmi will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and painting of the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will complete within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden but also help Laxmi to feel proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, metal, paint and electric materials.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isiya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Isiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Isiya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Isiya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Isiya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase crop yields.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 52-year-old widow with two children. They live in a small house without a hygienic latrine. She will use the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

Her main income is animal husbandry and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Ghofran

texts.en: Ghofran is a 30 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and one child who is still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, he is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s school educational fees. The parents’ only target is to provide her child with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her child’s school educational fees

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MECEDES DE KATAÑIRAY, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Liz es una mujer responsable y emprendedora ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de  confección de ropa deportiva, la socia espera con su negocio obtener mas ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, cierres, tijeras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank Las Mercedes de Katañiray. The bank is located in the district, Cusco, province of Cusco, administrative division of Cusco.

The borrower, Liz, is a responsible and enterprising woman. She mixes her daily activities making sports clothing. The borrower hopes to, with her business, obtain more earnings and in this way be able to continue helping her family, this being the manner that the borrower provides for her family.

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy fabric, zippers, and scissors, among other things.

The borrower feels grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman who lives in the city of Baybay with her family. She is 40 years old and a mother of five children; they are 20, 18, 17, 14, and a 5-year-old son. Her husband is a farmer, while Analyn is engaged in charcoal selling.

They work hard together to support and provide for the needs of their children and give them better education. Thus, Analyn is asking for a loan to buy coconut shells to process into charcoal.

In the future, she wants to improve her business to give a good life to her family.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells to process into charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado debido a la pobreza de su familia, ella es la segunda de seis hermanos y por esa razón tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus hermanos; actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, de esa manera han sacado adelante a sus hijos y ahora está criando tres sobrinos que quedaron sin padres cuando el ultimo sobrino tenía tan solo cuatro meses de nacido, pues sus padres murieron en manos de la delincuencia.

María, trabaja en los oficios de la casa, mientras su esposo y dos de sus hijos trabajan en la agricultura; ella prepara los alimentos para que ellos lleven hasta el lugar donde trabajan y otros cuidados de la casa; su principal fuente de ingreso es la ayuda económica que le brindan sus dos hijos que están prestando servicio militar.

El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar dos sacos de abono químico de 200 libras cada uno para abonar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y para comprar dos quintales de maíz, porque debido a la sequía no obtuvieron cosecha en primera que sembraron.   

El sueño más grande de María, es construir la casa aunque sea de adobe y ampliarla un poco más su casa porque son bastantes miembros de su familia y no tienen privacidad.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, has only a 3rd grade education due to the poverty of her family.  She is the second of 6 siblings, and for this reason she had to work to help her family.  She is now married, and her husband is a farmer.  This is how they have provided for their children, and now they are raising 3 nephews who were orphaned.  When the youngest of the nephews was only 4 months old, the parents died at the hands of criminals.

Maria takes care of the housework while her husband and 2 of her children work in agriculture.  She prepares food that they take to the place where they work, and does other housework.  The main source of income for the household is the financial support that 2 of her sons are providing who work in the military.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy 2 sacks of chemical fertilizer (200 lbs. each) to fertilize 10,500 square meters of corn.  She will also use the funds to buy 200 pounds of corn, because due to the drought they did not get a harvest from their first planting.

Maria's greatest dream is to expand her house, which is made of adobe, because there are quite a few members of the family, and they lack privacy.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and corn

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 23 year old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of motorcycle transport which he started way back in 2013 with a hope of increasing his family income. He also grows rice, maize and banana plus running a restaurant that adds him more income. He has future prospects of buying another motorcycle, however he is limited by weather changes which make roads impassible and destroy his motorcycle. Benson needs a loan to rent a rice garden harvest and later sell the produce. The extra person in the photo is the client's child who was caught up in the photo.

loans.use: to rent a rice garden harvest and later sell.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 56-year old lady; her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan

Her son owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures wooden four wheel carts. He has been making wooden carts for many years and teaching his arts to his son as well. Now her son has become a fine carpenter and can easily run a separate business, so he opened a new shop. Now he wants to buy his all tools and raw material for making carts.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy raw material such as wooden planks, wheels etc.
Nagina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as wooden planks, wheels etc. for her son's carpenter work.

loans.name: Ghali

texts.en:
Ghali  is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ghali has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Ghali would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ghali can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Ghali will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ghali is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is 33 years old with 8 children where in the oldest is 16 and the youngest is 3 weeks.

Irenia and her husband operates their gravel, sand and cement for sale business. Her husband used to be a helper but the salary is not enough for their family needs. When her husband laid off from the work. They decided to put the business with PhP 5,000 from his separation pay. Their business is doing good and helps so much to sustain their family basic expenses and school expenses of five of her children.
Today, Their business is gaining more customers but they cant supply the demands due to lack of capital.

Irenia is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 12,000 to buy 1 truckload of cement, gravel and sand to sell and deliver to her customers.

Irenia wanted to expand her business and stock more sand and gravel in the future to help more in their big family specially for the education of the children.

loans.use: to buy 1 truckload of cement, gravel and sand to sell and deliver to her customers.

loans.name: Raz

texts.en:
Raz is a 24-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and her two siblings. Her parents are the main income source in order to satisfy their family needs and demands and to be able to enhance their way of living.

As for Raz, she is focusing on her study and works in parallel as an employee in a company. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for her English courses.

In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to do more courses.

loans.use: to pay for her English courses.

loans.name: Marycel

texts.en:
Marycel is very grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT), in partnership with KIVA, has granted her previous loan request of PHP 15,000 and she considered it as a big blessing to her and her business. The loan was used to buy spare parts needed for the maintenance of her two pedicabs. She has also started to save for another pedicab unit that she plans to rent out to her hardworking neighbor.

Marycel is geared towards her dream of having a successful business that she can use to help other people. She wants to have enough income and savings for the future of her young child. She is also burdened with the health condition of her brother in-law, and she is aiming to give them financial help.

With this in mind, she applied for another PHP 15,000 loan basically to use for the hospitalization of her brother in-law. She will also set aside some amount for the usual pedicab spare parts and to add savings for another unit. She's positive that you will consider her request again, as she has already proven her integrity by faithfully paying her previous loan.

She continuously meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to use for the hospitalization of her brother in-law; to buy pedicab spare parts and to add savings for another unit.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. She is 33 years old and a mother of three children. Her oldest child is five years old while her youngest child is one-year-old. Analiza has always been dreaming of a business improvement to have better means of living in the future. And as to give her daughters a good education, for them to have better lives. So, she decided to raise pigs to augment their livelihood. She is starting up a hog raising business but her problem is their feed. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Felicisimo

texts.en:
Felicisimo is a fish vendor. He was taught this business at an early age because he had to learn in order to help his family. And now he has his own family to raise, he needs to work harder to support his children. Thus, he has six children; they are 14, 13, 10, 9, 8 and 2 years old. His wife stays at home and takes good care of them.

With this loan, he needs to improve his business so he could raise them well. Felicisimo is need of an amount to buy more fish to sell, so as to increase his profit and enhance his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sold basic house hold commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and variety of canned goods.
She is 46-year- old married woman with five children. Two of her children are still attending school. 
  
She  is asking for a loan to purchase goods for the store like rice, hard drinks and pay for school fees.  With these, she could now could maintain the inventory and attract potential customers to shop.
Lourdes is determined that she could make it to be more productive to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the store like rice, hard drinks and pay for school fees

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
These are some of the products that Delma, 45 years old, sells as direct selling representative. There are household needs and personal care products. She has few stocks because her usual practice is to show brochures to customers and get their orders. She will then advance the amount (either full or partial) to buy those pre-ordered products and give her customers one-month-to-pay credit. Therefore if she aims to increase her profit, she has to get more orders, and she has to advance considerable amount of capital. If she has higher capital, she can also stock up more items that she can readily sell.

Because it’s Christmas season, she knows that she can get volume orders from customers. She is in need of PHP 20,000 additional capital to procure their orders. The anticipated increase in her profit will be very helpful in sustaining her family’s everyday needs and school expenses of her daughter in college. It will also contribute in the happy celebration of Christmas for her whole family. 

Delma is married to Hermando, a draftsman, and their child is now in college. They live in Tigbauan, Iloilo where CCT has been operating and was able to form several fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. They meet every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans. Delma is consistent in attending this weekly fellowship because she can draw strength and inspiration from sharing of  testimonies and study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to pay for volume orders of personal and home products for selling

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 54 year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of emptying toilets in schools and around Fort Portal town. He started this business after discovering that many people in his area are facing a health problem of septic tanks getting full and lacking space to construct new ones. He decided to start up this business to help his community with his services. He is faced with challenges of inadequate capital to do the work he is given since payments come at a later stage. Besides that, he has a dream of expanding his services to many schools and buying a strong machine to quicken his work. Charles has asked for a loan to  buy a machine for emptying septic tanks.

loans.use: to buy a machine for emptying septic tanks

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca, tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Ella se ha dedicado al hogar y también a la agricultura, cultivando granos básicos y caña de azúcar. Hace  más de 10 años cultiva su propia parcela de café el cual es de buena calidad y es vendido en la misma localidad.
