Está solicitando un préstamo de 12,000.00 Lempiras que planea invertir en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de la finca y sembrar en otra parcela de café para obtener una mayor cantidad de producción que aumente sus ingresos. Su meta es sembrar otras parcelas y  mejorar su finca a fin de tener productos de mejor calidad y con los ingresos lograr hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is 57 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in the city of Gracias, Lempira. In addition to being a homemaker, she makes a living in agriculture by farming staple grains and sugar cane. She has been farming coffee on her own plot of land for more than 10 years. Her coffee is of good quality and it is sold in the same area where she grows it.

Doña Francisca is requesting a loan of 12,000 Lempiras, which she plans to use to buy manure and fertilizer for the maintenance of her farm. She will also grow coffee on another plot of land with this loan to increase her production and earn more income. Her goal is to farm other plots of land and improve her farm to produce higher quality crops. With her earnings, her goal is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for her farm and grow more coffee.

loans.name: Hendra

texts.en:
This is Hendra, one of Ruma agents who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Hendra is happily married and together with his wife, they have one daughter. As a main source of income, Hendra owns and manages a small stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits.

As the business runs, Hendra is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In near future, Hendra also plans to improve his selling in new product from Ruma, which is an e-commerce for lower communities called 'Mapan'.

In the photo, Hendra is standing at his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community

loans.name: Cindy Yanira

texts.es:
Cindy, es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° año de bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, por el momento no tienen hijos pero esperan hacer mas grande su familia en un futuro.


Cindy, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, actividad que aprendió de su madre a  los 10 años de edad, su madre siempre le inculcó buenos valores y esforzarse haciendo bien el trabajo, así es como ella ha logrado superarse y salir adelante.


El crédito le ayudará a Cindy para comprar abono y veneno para aplicarlo a los cultivos de maíz.



El sueño de Cindy es seguir trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida y trabajar duramente para hacer una mayor producción de maíz.
texts.en:
Cindy is a young and enterprising 19 year old woman, she studied until 2nd grade. She has a partner who earns a living from agriculture, at the moment they do not have children but they hope to make their family bigger in the future. 

Cindy earns a living from cleaning, something that she learnt from her mother at 10 years of ago. Her mother always taught her good values and made the importance of good work clear to her, this is how she has managed to succeed and move forward. 

The credit will help Cindy to buy fertilizer and poison to use on her maize harvests. 

Cindy's dream is to continue working to improve her quality of life and work hard to produce a better maize harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and poison to use on her maize harvests.

loans.name: Rosa Emeli

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39  años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando porque su familia no tenía los suficientes recursos para que ella continuara; está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, juntos tienen tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en la escuela.

Rosa, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas, este negocio se lo enseño su madre; pero también junto a su pareja se dedica al cultivo de café.  

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de café y para comprar jocotes porque es la fruta que ahorita se está vendiendo.

Los sueños que Rosa tiene, son seguir trabajando junto a su pareja para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y en un futuro poder tener una finca que les permita exportar café a otros paises.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, has only a 2nd grade education.  She wasn't able to stay in school because her family could not afford for her to continue.  Rosa has a partner who is a farmer.  Together, they have 3 children, 2 of whom are in school.

Rosa has been selling fruit for 7 years; she learned this business from her mother.  She also works with her husband growing coffee.

Rosa needs a loan to buy fertilizers for her coffee crops and to buy jocotes, which is the type of fruit she is now selling.

Rosa dreams of continuing to work with her partner to improve her family's quality of life so that in the future they could have a farm and export coffee to other countries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fruit

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer from Kusa village. As a Babban Gona member, Idris is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Idris would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Idris can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Idris no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Idris hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is 46 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of four children, and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their entire family. Mukhtaran has also been involved in a business selling clothes for the past ten years, and contributes her income to help manage the household.

Mukhtaran needs to buy different types of clothes for the purpose of reselling but is not in a position to do so due to insufficient financial means. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can easily purchase the clothes to fulfill her business needs in order to earn more income to support her family and business.

Mukhtaran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase different types of clothes.

loans.name: Rohati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Rohati, who is 40 years old and married with one son. Rohati has a small shop, and her husband has been selling leaves.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family's income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Rohati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation facilities at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Najiyu

texts.en:
Najiyu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Najiyu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Najiyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Najiyu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Najiyu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Najiyu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase crop yields.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 42 years old with two children.

Rosita has operated her eatery for five years and has been working hard, going to the market by 3:00 a.m. and cooking all the menu until closing down at 10 p.m. to support her family, especially for her children in school.

Rosita is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 17,000 to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, vegetables and spices for additional menu items in her eatery.

Rosita hopes to improve her eatery and expand to add a sari sari (variety) store to generate more income to save up for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, vegetables and spices for additional menu items in her eatery.

loans.name: Marlowe

texts.en:
Marlowe is a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. He is a 38-year-old man and raises his family through driving his “habal-habal” (a motorcycle with an extended seat to accommodate more passengers). He has been driving this every day for three years to earn a living and to support the needs of his family.

Thus, he is asking a loan for maintenance. In the future, he aims for business improvement to have sustainable earnings.

Additionally, Marlowe has three children to raise; they are 14, 12 and 10 years old.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 29-year-old, married woman of one child. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfill their family needs and be always ready to meet their demands.

He owns a pastry shop, and his income is barely sufficient. That’s why, today, in order to pay her child’s nursery fees, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she will be able to help him and ensure him a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her child’s nursery fees.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children, none of whom attend school because they are all grown-up. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

Agnes has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer visionaria, una persona enfocada en sus metas y sueños, vive en la zona rural del municipio de Dabeiba, se dedica a la cría y engorde de ganado bovino, inicio estas actividades por tratar de alcanzar sus sueños tales como pagar la educación del ser que más ama en el planeta su hijo de 17 años de edad, por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por querer comprar vivienda propia, sueños que con trabajado duro, siendo constante y con la ayuda de Dios, logrará.
Clara quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, el dinero será destinado en la compra de terneras para seba y levante.
texts.en:
Clara is a visionary. She is a person who is focused on her goals and dreams. She lives in the rural section of the city of Dabeiba. She makes a living raising and fattening beef cattle. She began working in this occupation in order to achieve her dreams which includes paying for the education of the person whom she loves most on this planet - her son who is 17 years old. Other dreams of Clara include improving the condition of her home and buying her own home. Through hard work and consistent focus, with the help of God, she will reach her dreams.

Clara would like to request a loan to invest in her business. The money will be used to buy calves to fatten and raise.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten and raise.

loans.name: José Fredy

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos que viven en casa y asisten a la escuela.

José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, el trabajo lo aprendió con sus padres desde muy pequeño, la parcela le queda a 30  minutos de su casa y se va a pie y sus hijos son quienes le ayudan cuando regresan de la escuela.


José necesita este préstamo para comprar insumos como abono, fertilizantes, venenos entre otros para realizar siembra de maíz.


Su sueño es tener un lugar propio para cultivar y ya no tener que trasladarse tan lejos.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old and has a partner who earns a living from cleaning, they have 4 children who attend school.

Jose has always earned a living from agriculture and has spent approximately 30 years doing this. He learned how to do this work from his parents from a very young ages, his plot of land is 30 minutes from his house and he travels there by foot and is helped by his children when they get back from school.

José needs this loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and poisons, amongst other things in order to cultivate his maize. 

His dream is to have his own place to grow and no longer need to travel so far.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and poison amongst other things in order to cultivate maize

loans.name: Mulyanti

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Mulyanti, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. As a main source of income, Mulyanti owns and manages a small stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for her community. Mulyanti is a really hardworking woman; she realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income because they have three boys who need to continue their school. That's why she decided to join Ruma.

As the business runs, Mulyanti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In near future, Mulyanti also plans to improve her selling with a new product from Ruma, which is e-commerce for lower communities called "Mapan."

In the photo, Mulyanti is sitting in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 61-year-old woman who lives in Calape, Bohol with her family. She is married and has four children. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) business where she sells variety of goods. She has been doing this for 20 years.

Linda has become proficient in this business and she eagerly wants to enhance this livelihood. Her problem is she is lacking capital to run this business continuously because her capital is used for other emergency needs such as daily consumption and bills. For this reason, she needs a bigger loan amount to buy commodities needed in her store.

She will purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice. Thus, Linda wants in the future to enhance her store business to be able to start other business opportunities that augment her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a tea farmer, which he has been doing for some good time. He was inspired after gaining enough experience while working as a casual worker on a big tea plantation. There he obtained capital that enabled him to start up his own farm.

Micheal is facing challenges of inadequate capital to pay his casual workers, given the fact that what he supplies the factory comes at the end of the month thus delaying his growth. However, in the future he intends to extend his residential house and his tea plantation to new areas.

Micheal used his previous loan to rent tea plantations and improve the old ones.

Micheal is requesting a loan to buy tea to top-up his harvest which he will sell.

loans.use: to buy tea to top up his harvest.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil, 28, is a married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecil has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Cecil requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

In the future, Cecil would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan David es un joven de 20 años de edad, que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar una motocicleta e iniciar como empresario independiente un negocio de transporte de peatones en el municipio de Ebejico.
El principal motivo por el cual Juan David quiere iniciar el negocio es que busca a toda costa un medio de sostenimiento para costearse sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Juan David is a 20 year-old youth who is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to start an independent business transporting people in the municipality of Ebejico.

The main reason Juan David wants to start a business is that he is seeking a means to support himself and pay for his university studies.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nurcihan

texts.en:
Nurcihan is a mother of two. She loves the cleaning business and thinks that she can find continuous job in this business so she started with house cleaning. Later on she established her own company and continued in this business.

She does cleaning with her employees for global companies, dockyards and ships. Last month she opened another store selling cleaning products and now she is running both. With he help of her fourth loan she is planning to buy cleaning products. She aims to become a company in demand and become a company with branches.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nurcihan Hanım iki çocuk annesi. Temizlik işini çok seven ve bu sektör de sürekli iş bulabileceğini düşünen Nurcihan Hanım önce kendisi ev temizliklerine başlıyor, daha sonra şirket kurarak bu işe devam ediyor. Elemanları ile birlikte kurumsal firmalara, tersanelere, gemilere temizliğe gidiyor. Geçen ay bulunduğu şehirde temizlik malzemeleri satan bir dükkan açtı iki işini bir arada yürütüyor. Aldığı dördüncü kredi ile dükkanına temizlik malzemeleri alacak. Amacı aranan ve şubeleri olan bir firma olmak.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es: Jairo es u hombre soltero de 49 años de edad, entregado cuerpo y alma al campo, su actividad principal es la producción de leche, pero actualmente tiene su negocio a media máquina dado que tiene unas vacas que han cumplido su ciclo, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras en periodo de gestación para reemplazar las que están en avanzada edad, además comprara vacunas y alimento para tenerlas en óptimas condiciones, puesto que estos animales son muy propensos a enfermedades que acaban con sus vidas o con la de sus terneros.
texts.en:
Jairo is a 49-year-old single man committed body and soul to the land. His principal occupation is milk production, but his business is actually running at half speed because some of his cows have completed their cycle.

For that, he is requesting a loan to buy dairy cows in the gestation period to replace the ones advancing in age. Furthermore, he will buy vaccines and food to have them in optimal condition, given that these animals are prone to illnesses that end their and their calves' lives.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to replace ones about to complete their cycle.

loans.name: Aimée Florentine

texts.fr:
Florentine vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Avec lequel, elle a pu augmenter un peu la quantité et la qualité de ses marchandises, elle a acheter des draps, couettes et rideaux d'occasion. 
Puisque l'objectif n'est pas encore atteint, et avec son esprit combatif, elle voudrait encore avancer et espère que vous allez encore lui accorder un autre prêt pour acheter d'autres articles comme robes de nuits léger, des pantalons et des sacs de couchages. Elle arrive maintenant à joindre tous les deux jours des grands marchés d'autres villes. Pour être autonome, elle projette de construire sa propre maison un jour et elle s'efforce de faire des économies maintenant pou pouvoir y parvenir.
texts.en: Florentine thanks you very much for the loan. With it she was able to increase the quantity and quality of her merchandise, and bought sheets, quilts and second-hand curtains. Because the goal has not yet been achieved, and with her fighting spirit, she wants to keep moving forward and hopes that you will offer her an additional loan so that she can buy more merchandise such as light night gowns, trousers and sleeping bags. She is now able to join the large markets in other cities every two days. To become independent, she plans on one day building her own home and is saving money to do so.

loans.use: to buy night gowns, trousers and sleeping bags.

loans.name: Estefany Betsabé

texts.es:
Estefany es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° año de bachillerato, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de soldado, a{un no tiene hijos y por lo tanto solo vive con su pareja.


Estefany se dedica al comercio de ropa en una zona cercana donde ella vive, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la actividad, para ir a vender tiene que agarrar bus todos los días a las 8 a.m.  nadie mas se involucra en su trabajo pues su pareja labora como soldado.


Estefany necesita este crédito para comprar camisas, pantalones, calzonetas, calcetines, ropa interior, etc, para seguir adelante con su negocio.


Ella siempre ha soñado con terminar de construir su casa ya que tiene 2 años de haber parado la construcción por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Estefany is a young hard-working 19 year old, she studied until 2nd grade. At the moment she has a partner who is a solider, they do not have children and so she only lives with her partner.

Estefany earns a living selling clothes in an area near to where she lives, she has spent 4 years doing this. To be able to go and sell she has to catch the bus everyday day at 8am. Noone else works with her so her partner works as a soldier. 

Estefany needs this loan to buy tops, trousers, shorts, socks, underwear etc. to continue moving forward with her business. 

She has always dreamed of building her own house, given that it has been 2 years she has had to stop construction due to a lack of money.

loans.use: to buy tops, trousers, shorts, socks, underwear etc. to be able to move her business forward.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a resident of Gunpur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 27 years old. She is living with her small family, her husband and three children. Her husband is a mason. Anita makes leaf plates and sells them in a nearby market to add some extra income for her family.

She has the basic necessities of life, with a small but permanent income and other allied items to manage her family. Still her family members are not so happy because they lack a good RCC house.

At present Anita and her family are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent. The rented house is made from mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during rainy season. The most important thing is the house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a small but standard house with all possible facilities. She has already started to construct the house. But she lacks sufficient funds to complete it. So she decided to borrow loan from any bank or other financial institution.

Anita came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. From the loan Anita will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden but also help Anita to feel proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, metal, color and electrical materials.

loans.name: Bhagya

texts.en:
Bhagya is resident of Pradhaniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 42 years old. She has a small family, her husband and two sons. Vegetable vending is the main occupation of her husband. Bhagya is a health worker and working as an ASHA (accredited social health activist).

She has the basic necessities of life, like a small but permanent income and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not so happy because they lack a pakka (stone) house.

At present they are staying at rented house with a high rate of rent charged by the house owner. The rented house is made of mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during rainy season. It is also very critical to stay during winter period. The most important thing is the house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, Bhagya decided to construct an RCC (reinforced concrete) house. She has already started to construct the house. But she lacks the funds to complete it. So she decided to borrow loan from any bank or other financial institution.

Bhagya came to Mahashakti Foundation to know about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. From the loan Bhagya will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring of the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months and she will be proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, metal, color and electric materials.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FUENTE DE VIDA” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), tienda de abarrotes, venta de accesorios para vehículos, venta de helados, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de accesorios para vehículos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando como vendedora y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace un año.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de accesorios para vehículos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece la señora Susy ya que, después del desembolso, tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The community association “FUENTE DE VIDA” will begin it's twelfth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Villa Exaltación. The group is comprised of nine members, and it is led by an executive board in which señora Elsa is the President. The members of the association run a variety of different businesses which include selling coca, selling chuño (dehydrated potato), a grocery store, selling vehicle accessories, selling ice cream, and selling food.

The loan that this group is applying for will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs which includes señora Elsa who is a member. Elsa joined Pro Mujer eight years ago when a friend of hers who is a client of the institution invited her to join. Currently, she has a business selling vehicle accessories. She learned about this business through working as a salesperson and she decided to start her own business a year ago.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital (to buy vehicle accessories at wholesale). She will purchase these accessories from wholesalers in the city of El Alto, and subsequently sell them at her shop. This type of work enables her to earn income to financially support her family, which includes her husband and two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she like the health services and the savings that the institution offers.

Señora Susy does not appear in the photo because after she made her payment, she had to return to her shop.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories at wholesale.

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
Judita is a 29-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol, in the Philippines.  She is married with three young children between the ages of 8 and 11 years old.  Her husband works hard as a baker while Judita is engaged in a direct sales business to help her husband with their daily expenses.  

Judita buys and sells personal products such as cosmetics, beauty products, fit and trendy products, fragrances, shoes, apparel, and home care products.  She will use the requested loan to buy these products.  Judita wishes to be successful in her business as well as in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty products, fit and trendy products, fragrances, shoes, apparel, and home care products.

loans.name: Kisoga Group

texts.en:
Warda, who is in her mid 20s, is single and has two children who are still at school.

For six years now, she has been running several projects like selling charcoal, nuts and honey. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be Warda's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her charcoal stock and to start selling honey and ground nuts and has managed to repay all her loans successfully.

She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for their support. She used the profit to buy a plot of land, build her own house, repay the loan, pay school fees and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase her stocks of honey and ground nuts. She dreams of expanding her business.

Warda will share this loan with her loan group, "Kisoga," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, to increase on honey and ground nuts stocks.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a woman who is 38 years old. She is from Tubigon Bohol, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 16 years old while her youngest child is 6 years old. Her husband is a habal-habal (a motorcycle with extended seat) driver while Nenita is engaged in a business selling food in their community. She has been doing this business for 12 years to earn a living.

Nenita and her husband work together to provide enough food for the family. She is asking for a loan to buy food such as fruits, peanuts, chips and candies. In addition to this, she will also buy feeds as she also raises pigs for additional income. Nenita wishes to uplift their livelihood to have enough money to improve their house.

loans.use: to buy food such as fruits, peanuts, chips and candies and feed.

loans.name: Ofelia Merita

texts.es:
Ofelia Merita con 42 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ofelia María se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero (vacas), con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 05 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cerdos y cuyes. Solicita préstamo para la compra de terneras y animales menores. De esta manera le facilitará obtener mayores ingresos a su unidad familiar.

Ofelia María cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ofelia María  is 42 years old, she has a partner and they live together with their children in Lagunas district, Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department of Peru. She relies on good personal and working references from the inhabitants of the zone. The residents of this area mainly earn a living from agriculture, business and livestock.

Ofelia María earns a living raising milking cows, with experience in this trade for over 5 years. Additionally she earns money from raising and selling animals such as pigs and guinea pigs.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy calves and young animals. This will allow her to earn more income for her family. Ofelia María has a good loan history and is a reoccurring partner for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy calves and young animals

loans.name: Sati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sati, who is a 50-year-old, married woman with eight children. Sati has been selling vegetables, and her husband is a tailor.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Sati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation facilities at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Habib Ahmad

texts.en:
Habib Ahmad is aged 27. He is an energetic man living with his parents in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is supporting his sibling as well; his forefathers have been doing the same business for many years and he got all the buffalo’s inheritance.

He is a milkman by profession; he sells milk in his community and produces yogurt and butter for his family members' personal use. He lives in a rural area and the roads are unpaved. He has to provide milk door-to-door by using his bicycle; it is very difficult for him to carry milk cans by bicycle.

He wants to access more customers so he can offer more milk and can generate more income for his family. He is facing a problem coping with the rapid increase in inflation and household expenses. He wants to buy a mini wagon but does not have enough cash in hand and savings; this is the reason he is compelled to take a loan.

Habib Ahmad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to buy a mini wagon carry more milk cans. He will use a portion of the profit amount for purchasing fodder. He hopes that his production will increase and he can easily cope with the inflation.

Habib Ahmad thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a mini wagon to carry milk cans to supply retailers and customers.

loans.name: David Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un hombre de 57 años de edad que diariamente trabaja por sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, es un agricultor de nacimiento, espera seguir ejerciendo esta profesión hasta el día de su muerte, ama mucho lo que se hace pues a lo largo de su vida el campo le ha dado lo que tiene.
Este campesino que toda la vida ha perseguido un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos, venenos y pago de jornales, espera recibir tu apoyo para seguir realizando la profesión con la que genera el dinero para comprar el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a 57 year old man who works every day to move his 3 children forward. He is a farmer from birth. He hopes to keep working at this profession until the day he dies. He loves what he does very much, since throughout his life, the fields have given him what he has.

For his whole life this farmer has been pursued by the dream of buying his own home. He wants to ask for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, weed killers, and to pay for laborers. He hopes to receive your support in order to continue carrying out the profession which which he makes money to buy his daily bread.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and weed killers, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Alfa De Jesus

texts.es:
Alfa es una mujer luchadora, una persona increíble no solo por su historia, por su capacidad de liderazgo, ella quedó viuda a cargo de una familia conformada por 5 hijos, ella se había dedicado a las labores del hogar, pero por una clara necesidad económica optó por comenzar con la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, ocupando un cuarto de su hogar y convirtiéndolo en una tienda.
Para tratar de dar una idea de lo mucho que se sacrifica esta mujer pro su familia, basta con decir que trabaja 16 horas diarias en su tienda, solo pro generar los ingresos necesarios para no pasar necesidades.
Actualmente la cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con productos de primera necesidad como Arroz, aceite, café, panela, azúcar, producto de aseo personal y doméstico.
texts.en:
Alfa is a tenacious woman who is an unbelievable person, not only because of her story, but also because of her leadership abilities.  She was left a widow in charge of a family with 5 children.  She used to be a housewife, but due to a clear financial need she chose to start selling consumer products from a room in her house that she converted into a store.

To try to give you a sense of how much she sacrifices for her family, it suffices to say that she works 16 hours a day in her store.  With her work she is able to generate the income needed to pay for basic necessities.

At this time, Alfa is requesting a loan to stock up her store with consumer staples such as rice, cooking oil, coffee, raw sugar, refined sugar, personal care items, and household cleaning products.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira de 44 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad en casa de su propiedad. Ella se gana la vida con su tienda de productos básicos la cual instalo para contar con una fuente de ingresos permanente. Yanira mejoro su vivienda con el crédito anterior, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro, cemento, arena y mano de obra para reparar el portón de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado, ya que este es el que le brinda seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Yanira is 44 years old and is a single mother who lives with her two children of 18 and 14 years of age in her own house. 

She earns a living from her shop selling basic goods which she relies upon for a source of income. 

Yanira improved her home with the previous loan which is why she is asking for a new FUSAI loan to invest in iron, cement, sand and labour to repair the gate to her home which is now run down, she needs it to provide security for her family.

loans.use: to invest in: iron, cement, sand and labour to repair the gate to her house

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor is 41 years old and he lives in Syunik village of Syunik region. Grigor has a higher medical education and he is a dentist with a very high qualification. For many years until now he has worked in his specialty; he is a dentist at the city’s hospital.

Grigor is married and he has a nice 5-year-old daughter. He lives with his wife, daughter and retired father, who greatly helps him with the gardening which Grigor is engaged in with great pleasure and interest. He has a big and very nice fruit garden where he has apple, pear, peach and plum trees.

These fruits Grigor’s father sells at the city’s wholesale market. Grigor mentions that it is great pleasure to take care of and work in his garden and also to have such a sweet and tasty harvest for sale and for his family's use as well.

Now Grigor is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as before winter comes he wants to repair the water pipes of his fruit garden, he also wants to buy seedlings, young apple trees and also diesel fuel in order to end all his agricultural work before the first snow.

loans.use: to repair the water pipes in his fruit garden, to buy seedlings, young apple trees  and also diesel fuel to finish all his agricultural works before the first snow.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita lives a simple life with her family in Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has six children. The oldest child is 20 years old, while her youngest child is 11 years old. Her husband is a “tuba” (coconut wine) gatherer while Mercedita sells vinegar. This vinegar is made from the coconut wine.

Thus, Mercedita is asking a loan to buy “tungog" (is a tannin powder used to give color to the coconut wine). Aside from this, she will also buy “saguran” known as raffia. Raffia is a brown, grassy fiber used for crafts and as a packing material. Mercedita is thinking to start other business opportunities like raffia weaving.

She wants, in the future, to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy “tungog" for coconut wine and “saguran” for weaving.

loans.name: Miladys

texts.es: Para Miladys este día, estás palabras expresadas en medio escrito, representar una enorme oportunidad en su vida, pues actualmente está intentando recaudar fondos por medios de un crédito para comprar una silla de salón de belleza y los químicos necesarios para iniciar formalmente un negocio de peluquería, algo que la llena de orgullo y de impaciencia por querer tener los implementos necesarios y empezar lo más pronto con su negocio, por ello espera recibir su apoyo.
texts.en: For Miladys, this day and the written words on this page represent an enormous opportunity for her life. Currently, she is trying to raise funds by taking out a loan to buy a beauty salon chair and chemicals necessary to formally start her own hairdressing business. This business idea is something which fills Miladys with pride and also impatience, since she wants to have the necessary tools and start her business as soon as possible. She hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy a beauty salon chair and chemicals necessary for her to formally start a hairdressing business.

loans.name: Rumsiah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Rumsiah, who is a 48-year-old woman who is married with eight children. Rumsiah has been selling meatballs and her husband is a driver.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 6,700,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities in their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Rumsiah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation facilities in their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Suhaidah

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Suhaidah, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. As a main source of income, she owns and manages a small stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for her community. Suhaidah is a really hardworking woman; she realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income because their children at home need to continue their school. That's why she decided to join Ruma, as well as to give more contribution to her community.

As the business runs, Suhaidah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Suhaidah also plans to improve her selling with a new product from Ruma, which is e-commerce for lower communities called "Mapan."

In the photo, Suhaidah is sitting in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community.

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Asiah, who is a 53-year-old, married woman with three daughters and two sons. Asiah is a breeder, and her husband has been selling fruits.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Asiah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation facilities at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Johnnathan Harold

texts.es:
Johnnathan Harold, tiene 22 años de edad, es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Electrónica y telecomunicaciones, lleva tres años estudiando, le gusta su carrera ya que esta interesado en todo lo relacionado a las señales digitales y seguridad informativa.
Durante sus estudios los únicos inconvenientes que se le habían presentado son los económicos ya que aveces no se podían pagar las cuotas dela universidad en su fecha y se veía en peligro de perder exámenes. Él es un buen estudiante con muy buenas notas.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de cuotas de su universidad. Asimismo manifiesta su agradecimiento a las personas que le están brindando éste apoyo ya que para él es muy importante lograr tener una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Johnnathan Harold is 22 years old, is a young student studying electronic engineering and telecommunications. He has three years studying under his belt, likes his major, and is interested in everything related to digital signals and information security.

Throughout his studies, the only challenge has been an economic one since at times he was unable to pay the university fees on time and was in danger of losing out on exams. He is a good student with very good grades.

He will invest the loan received in the payment of his university fees. Likewise, he shows his gratitude the the people affording him this support because it is very important to him that he manages to have a professional career.

loans.use: to pay fees for electrical engineering studies.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou, 31, is married with six children. Her eldest child is 11, the youngest is 2. She runs a sari-sari (variety store), where she sells eggs, seasonings, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks. Aside from running a store, she raises and sells hogs. Her husband also has an income that could help support the needs of the entire family.

Analou has decided to avail a loan to buy more stock for the store as well as pig feed. With these investments, she can maximize her resources and maintain the flow of merchandise in her store. This would enable her to start saving and invest in any possible business to become successful.

She dreams of continuing to support the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store as well as pig feed.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn owns a small piggery in the community of Badian, Cebu. As a married woman with three children, she can only hope that her business will always go well and she can sell her hogs every four months.

This business of raising hogs started three years ago and helps her earn a living to contribute to the family's expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. Evelyn's income will be used to pay for her three children's school fees, food for the family and savings.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan is 33 years old and she lives with her husband and her mother. She moved from Noyemberyan city to Dilijan city of the Tavush region where she lives with her family. Ruzan has been married since 2004, but she has no children, which makes her and her husband so upset. Ruzan specialized in nursing, but she has never worked. Her husband works at the city’s police station.

Ruzan already paid back her first Kiva loan, which she hoped would help her solve her health problem. It seemed so real and so close, but she did not manage to succeed in solving her problem. Now, Ruzan is again full of expectations and with great hope of support.

Ruzan now asks her second Kiva loan in an amount of 1,450,000 Armenian drams with great hope that she will finally manage to solve her health problem.

loans.use: to finally solve her health problem.

loans.name: Twegonze Kigangaizi Women's Group

texts.en: Safinah is a married woman with three children all living in Masindi-Uganda. She is still in the fish selling business which has helped her to start up a retail shop that sells sugar, soap using the proceeds to add on her income. She wanted to improve on her standards of living thus starting the business. Safinah has a dream of buying land for farming, however she if affected by too much sunshine which affects her fish. She is a hardworking woman who needs a credit facility to buy fish for selling. Safinah is a member of Twegonze Kigangaizi Women's Group where by they guarantee each other to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses come from food costs.

Hellen has operated a retail shop business for the past four years. She sells household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan Hellen is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice is married and a mother of three. In order to support her husband financially she started working with her husband's encouragement.

She opened a millinary shop and runs it. At the same time she is doing wooden paintings and selling them in her shop. In the future she wants to expand her business and be successful in her wooden painting job.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hatice hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Eşine evde destek olmak, çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için eşinin desteği ile iş hayatına atılıyor. Kendisine küçük bir tuhafiye dükkanı açarak burayı işletiyor. Aynı zaman da ahşap boyama işi de yapıp dükkanında satıyor. Gelecek de işini büyütmek, özellikle ahşap işinde yükselmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto es un joven de 20 años de edad que se dedica a transportar personas en el municipio de Ebejico, trabajo pro lograr un objetivo a futuro de comprar una vivienda, actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para realizar algunas reformar a su motocicleta, el dinero del préstamo será para realizar un mantenimiento al motos, compra de llantas y pagar el seguro de técnomecanica.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is a young man who is 20 years old. He makes a living transporting people in the city of Ebejico. His goal is to buy a home with the money he earns through this work. Currently, he is requesting a loan to do some upgrades to his motorcycle.

The money from this loan will be used to service motorcycles, buy tires, and pay for the services of a mechanic.

loans.use: to service motorcycles, buy tires, and pay for the services of a mechanic.
